verses.latin: Factum est autem, postquam mortuus est Saul, ut David reverteretur a cæde Amalech, et maneret in Siceleg diebus duobus.
verses.english: Now, after King Saul had died, David returned from his victory over the Amalekites. He then remained in Ziklag for two days.

verses.latin: In die autem tertio apparuit homo veniens de castris Saul, veste conscissa, et capite pulverizato: et ut venit ad David, cecidit super faciem suam, et adoravit.
verses.english: On the third day, a man appeared, coming from Saul's military camp. His clothes were torn, and dust covered his head, showing his distress and mourning. When he came to David, he fell on his face and prostrated himself in homage.

verses.latin: Dixitque ei David: Unde venis? Qui ait illi: De castris Israël fugi.
verses.english: David asked him: "Where do you come from?" And the man replied: "I have escaped from the Israelite camp."

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eum David: Quod est verbum hoc, quod factum est? indica mihi. Qui ait: Fugit populus ex prælio, et multi corruerunt, et mortui sunt: sed et Saul et Jonathan filius ejus interierunt.
verses.english: And David asked him: "What is this news you bring, what has happened? Tell me." The man said: "The people have fled from the battle, and many have fallen and died. Even King Saul and his son Jonathan have perished."

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad adolescentem, qui nuntiabat ei: Unde scis quia mortuus est Saul et Jonathan filius ejus?
verses.english: David then asked the young man who was reporting this to him: "How do you know that Saul and his son Jonathan are dead?"

verses.latin: Et ait adolescens, qui nuntiabat ei: Casu veni in montem Gelboe, et Saul incumbebat super hastam suam: porro currus et equites appropinquabant ei.
verses.english: And the young man who was bringing him the news said: "By chance, I came upon Mount Gilboa, and there was Saul, leaning upon his spear. The chariots and horsemen of the enemy were drawing closer to him."

verses.latin: Et respexisset post tergum suum, viditque me, et vocavit. Cui cum respondissem: Adsum:
verses.english: When Saul looked behind himself, he saw me and called out. When I answered him, saying, 'Here I am,' he spoke to me, saying: 'Kill me, for I am in great distress, and yet my life is still in me.'"

verses.latin: dixit mihi: Quisnam es tu? Et dixi ad eum: Ego sum Amalechites.
verses.english: He said to me: 'Who are you?' And I said to him: 'I am an Amalekite.'

verses.latin: Et locutus est mihi: Interfice me, sum enim in angustiis valde, et adhuc tota anima mea in me est.
verses.english: And he spoke to me, saying: 'Kill me, for I am in great distress, and yet my life is still in me.'

verses.latin: Et stans super eum, interfeci illum: sciebam enim quod non posset vivere post casum. Et tuli diadema de capite ejus, et armillam de brachio ejus, et attuli ad te dominum meum huc.
verses.english: So I stood over him and killed him, for I knew that he could not survive his fall. Then I took the crown from his head and the bracelet from his arm, and I have brought them here to you, my lord."

verses.latin: Apprehendens autem David vestimenta sua, scidit, et omnes viri qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: Then David seized his own clothes and tore them, and all the men who were with him did likewise as a sign of deep mourning.

verses.latin: Et planxerunt, et fleverunt, et jejunaverunt usque ad vesperam super Saul, et super Jonathan filium ejus, et super populum Domini, et super domum Israël, eo quod corruissent gladio.
verses.english: And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until evening over Saul, and over his son Jonathan, and over the people of the Lord, and over the house of Israel, because they had fallen by the sword in battle.

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad adolescentem, qui nuntiaverat ei: Unde es tu? Qui respondit: Ego sum filius viri peregrini Amalechitæ.
verses.english: Then David asked the young man who had brought him the news: "Where are you from?" He replied: "I am the son of a foreign man, an Amalekite."

verses.latin: Et ait ad illum David: Quare non timuisti mittere manum tuam in ut occideres christum Domini?
verses.english: And David said to him: "Why were you not afraid to lay your hand on the Lord's anointed and kill him?" This means David was asking why the man wasn't afraid to violate God's sacred order.

verses.latin: Et vocans David unum de pueris suis, ait: Accedens interfice illum. Qui percussit eum, et mortuus est.
verses.english: Then David called one of his young men and said: "Go near and execute him." So the young man struck him down, and he died.

verses.latin: Et ait ad eum David: Sanguis tuus super caput tuum: os enim tuum locutum est adversum te, dicens: Ego interfeci christum Domini.
verses.english: And David said to the Amalekite: "Your blood is on your own head, for your own mouth testified against you when you said: 'I killed the Lord's anointed.'"

verses.latin: Planxit autem David planctum hujuscemodi super Saul, et super Jonathan filium ejus.
verses.english: Then David chanted this lament over Saul and over his son Jonathan.

verses.latin: Et præcepit ut docerent filios Juda cantum hujuscemodi: Ecce scriptum est in libro justorum.
verses.english: And he commanded that the children of Judah be taught this lament, which is recorded in the Book of Jashar, a collection of heroic deeds.

verses.latin: Inclyti Israël super montes tuos interfecti sunt: Quomodo ceciderunt fortes?
verses.english: O, the glory of Israel lies slain upon your mountains, O Gilboa! How have the mighty fallen?

verses.latin: Nolite annuntiare in Geth, neque annuntietis in compitis Ascalonis: ne forte lætentur filiæ Philisthiim, ne exsultent filiæ incircumcisorum.
verses.english: Do not declare it in Gath, nor announce it in the streets of Ashkelon, lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

verses.latin: Montes Gelboe, nec ros, nec pluvia veniant super vos, neque sint agri primitiarum: quia ibi abjectus est clypeus fortium, clypeus Saul, quasi non esset unctus oleo.
verses.english: O mountains of Gilboa, may no dew or rain fall upon you, nor may there be fields that yield first fruits. For there, the shield of the mighty was cast away, the shield of Saul, as if it had never been anointed with oil for battle.

verses.latin: A sanguine interfectorum, ab adipe fortium, sagitta Jonathan numquam rediit retrorsum, et gladius Saul non est reversus inanis.
verses.english: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty warriors, the arrow of Jonathan never turned back without striking, and the sword of Saul never returned empty.

verses.latin: Saul et Jonathan amabiles, et decori in vita sua, in morte quoque non sunt divisi: velociores aquilis, fortiores leonibus.
verses.english: Saul and Jonathan, beloved and beautiful in their lives, even in death they were not separated. They were swifter than eagles, stronger than lions.

verses.latin: Filiæ Israël, super Saul flete, qui vestiebat vos coccino in deliciis, qui præbebat ornamenta aurea vestris vestibus.
verses.english: O daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet and finery, who adorned your garments with ornaments of gold.

verses.latin: Quomodo ceciderunt fortes in prælio? Jonathan in excelsis tuis interfectus est.
verses.english: How have the mighty fallen in battle? Jonathan lies slain on your high places.

verses.latin: Doleo super te, frater mi Jonathan, decorus nimis, et amabilis super amorem mulierum. Sicut mater unicum amat filium suum, ita ego te diligebam.
verses.english: I grieve for you, my brother Jonathan. You were exceedingly delightful to me, and your love for me was more precious than the love of women. Just as a mother loves her only son, so I cherished you.

verses.latin: Quomodo ceciderunt fortes, et perierunt arma bellica?
verses.english: How have the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished?

verses.latin: Factum est autem, postquam mortuus est Saul, ut David reverteretur a caede Amalec, et maneret in Siceleg diebus duobus.
verses.english: After Saul had died, David returned from his conquest of the Amalekites, and he stayed in Ziklag for two days.

verses.latin: Et in die tertio apparuit homo veniens de castris Saul, veste conscissa, et pulvere conspersus caput: et ut venit ad David, cecidit super faciem suam, et adoravit.
verses.english: And on the third day, a man appeared. He was coming from Saul's camp. His clothes were torn, and his head was covered with dust. When he came to David, he fell on his face and prostrated himself in homage.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eum David: Unde venis? Qui ait illi: De castris Israël fugi.
verses.english: David asked him, "Where are you coming from?" The man replied to him, "I have fled from the camp of Israel."

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eum David: Quod est verbum, quod factum est? indica mihi. Qui ait: Fugit populus ex prælio, et multi corruerunt, et mortui sunt: sed et Saul et Jonathas filius ejus interierunt.
verses.english: David said to him, "What news has happened? Tell me." The man replied, "The people have fled from the battle, and many have fallen and died. Even Saul and his son Jonathan are dead."

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad adolescentem qui nuntiabat ei: Unde scis quia mortuus est Saul, et Jonathas filius ejus?
verses.english: David said to the young man who was bringing him the news, "How do you know that Saul and his son Jonathan are dead?"

verses.latin: Et ait adolescens, qui nuntiabat ei: Casu veni in montem Gelboe, et Saul incumbebat super hastam suam: porro currus et equites appropinquabant ei.
verses.english: The young man who was bringing the news said, "By chance, I came upon Mount Gilboa. Saul was leaning upon his spear, while chariots and horsemen were drawing near to him."

verses.latin: Et respexisset se post tergum suum, vidit me, et vocavit. Et dixi: Adsum.
verses.english: "When he looked behind himself, he saw me and called out. I replied, 'Here I am.'"

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Quisnam es tu? Et respondi ei: Ego sum Amalecites.
verses.english: "He said to me, 'Who are you?' I answered him, 'I am an Amalekite.'"

verses.latin: Et locutus est mihi: Sta super me, et interfice me: quoniam tenent me angustiæ, et adhuc tota est anima mea in me.
verses.english: "He said to me, 'Stand over me and kill me, because great anguish holds me, and my life is still completely within me.'"

verses.latin: Et stans super illum, interfeci eum: sciebam enim quod non posset vivere post casum. Et tuli diadema de capite ejus, et armillam de brachio ejus, et attuli ad te dominus meus huc.
verses.english: "So, standing over him, I killed him, for I knew that he could not live after his fall. I then took the crown from his head and the armlet from his arm, and I have brought them here to you, my lord."

verses.latin: Apprehendens autem David vestimenta sua, scidit, omnesque viri qui erant cum eo.
verses.english: Then David took hold of his own clothes and tore them. All the men who were with him did the same.

verses.latin: Et planxerunt, et fleverunt, et jejunaverunt usque ad vesperam super Saul, et super Jonathan filium ejus, et super populum Domini, et super domum Israël, eo quod corruissent gladio.
verses.english: They lamented and wept and fasted until evening over Saul, and over his son Jonathan, and over the Lord's people, and over the house of Israel, because they had died in battle.

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad adolescentem qui nuntiaverat ei: Unde es tu? Qui respondit: Ego sum filius viri alienigenae de Amalec.
verses.english: David then said to the young man who had brought him the news, "Where are you from?" He answered, "I am the son of a foreigner, an Amalekite."

verses.latin: Et ait ad eum David: Quare non timuisti mittere manum tuam in ut occideres christum Domini?
verses.english: David said to him, "Why did you not fear to stretch out your hand to kill the Lord's anointed?"

verses.latin: Et vocans David unum de pueris suis, ait: Accedens interfice eum. Qui percussit illum, et mortuus est.
verses.english: Then David called one of his young men, saying, "Come here and strike him down." The young man struck him, and he died.

verses.latin: Et ait ad eum David: Sanguis tuus super caput tuum: os enim tuum locutum est contra te, dicens: Ego interfeci christum Domini.
verses.english: David said to him, "Your blood is upon your own head. For your own mouth has testified against you, saying, 'I have killed the Lord's anointed.'"

verses.latin: Planxit autem David planctum hujuscemodi super Saul, et super Jonathan filium ejus:
verses.english: David then uttered this lamentation over Saul and over his son Jonathan:

verses.latin: et præcepit ut docerent filios Juda arma. Sicut scriptum est in libro justorum:
verses.english: He commanded that the sons of Judah should be taught this lamentation, called 'the Bow.' Indeed, it is written in the Book of Jashar:

verses.latin: Incliti Israël super montes tuos interfecti sunt: Quomodo ceciderunt fortes!
verses.english: "The glory of Israel is slain upon your mountains! How have the mighty fallen!"

verses.latin: Nolite annuntiare in Geth, neque annuncietis in compitis Ascalonis: ne forte lætentur filiæ Philisthiim, ne exsultent filiæ incircumcisorum.
verses.english: "Do not announce it in Gath, nor proclaim it in the streets of Ashkelon, lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph."

verses.latin: Montes Gelboe, nec ros, nec pluvia veniant super vos, neque sint agri primitiarum: quia ibi abjectus est clypeus fortium, clypeus Saul, quasi non esset unctus oleo.
verses.english: "O mountains of Gilboa, may no dew nor rain come upon you, nor fields that bear offerings, for there the shield of the mighty was cast away—the shield of Saul, as if he had not been anointed with oil."

verses.latin: De sanguine interfectorum, de adipe fortium, sagitta Jonathæ nunquam rediit retrorsum, et gladius Saul non est reversus inanis.
verses.english: "From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the arrow of Jonathan never returned without striking, and the sword of Saul never returned empty."

verses.latin: Saul et Jonathas amabiles et decori in vita sua, in morte quoque non sunt divisi: velociores aquilis, fortiores leonibus.
verses.english: "Saul and Jonathan, beloved and beautiful in their lives, in death also they were not divided. They were swifter than eagles, and stronger than lions."

verses.latin: Filiæ Israël super Saul flete, qui vestiebat vos coccino in deliciis, et qui præbebat ornamenta aurea vestris in vestibus.
verses.english: "O daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in luxurious scarlet and provided golden ornaments for your garments."

verses.latin: Quomodo ceciderunt fortes in prælio! Jonathas in excelsis tuis interfectus est.
verses.english: "How have the mighty fallen in battle! Jonathan is slain upon your high places!"

verses.latin: Doleo super te, frater mi Jonatha, decore nimis, et amabilis super omnem amorem fœminarum.
verses.english: "I grieve for you, my brother Jonathan, most beautiful, and more beloved than all the love of women, a love that surpassed even romantic love."

verses.latin: Quomodo ceciderunt fortes, et perierunt arma bellica!
verses.english: "How have the mighty fallen, and how have the weapons of war perished!"

verses.latin: Post hæc consuluit David Dominum, dicens: Num ascendam in unam de civitatibus Juda? Et ait Dominus ad eum: Ascende. Et rursum dixit David: Quo ascendam? Et respondit ei Dominus: In Hebron.
verses.english: After this, David consulted the Lord, saying: "Should I go up to one of the cities of Judah?" And the Lord said to him: "Go up." Then David asked again: "Where should I go up?" And the Lord answered him: "To Hebron."

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo David, et duæ uxores ejus, Achinoam Jezrahelitis, et Abigail uxor Nabal Carmeli.
verses.english: So David went up there, along with his two wives: Achinoam from Jezreel, and Abigail, who had been the wife of Nabal of Carmel.

verses.latin: Sed et viros qui erant cum eo, duxit David singulos cum domibus suis: et manserunt in civitatibus Hebron.
verses.english: And David also brought the men who were with him, each with his family, and they settled in the cities around Hebron.

verses.latin: Veneruntque viri Juda, et unxerunt ibi David ut regnaret super domum Juda. Et nuntiatum est David quod viri Jabes Galaad sepelissent Saul.
verses.english: Then the men of Judah came and anointed David there to reign over the house of Judah. And it was reported to David that the men of Jabesh-Gilead had buried Saul.

verses.latin: Misit ergo David nuntios ad viros Jabes Galaad, et dixit eis: Benedicti vos Domino, qui fecistis misericordiam hanc cum domino vestro Saul, et sepelistis eum.
verses.english: So David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh-Gilead and said to them: "May you be blessed by the Lord, because you showed this kindness to your lord Saul by burying him."

verses.latin: Et nunc retribuat vobis Dominus misericordiam et veritatem. Sed et ego reddam vobis bonum, eo quod fecistis verbum istud.
verses.english: And now, may the Lord repay you with kindness and truth. And I myself will also reward you with good because you have done this deed.

verses.latin: Confortentur manus vestræ, et estote viri: quoniam mortuus est dominus vester Saul: et me unxit domus Juda sibi in regem.
verses.english: Therefore, strengthen your hands and be courageous men, for your lord Saul is dead, and the house of Judah has anointed me as their king.

verses.latin: Abner autem filius Ner, princeps exercitus Saul, tulit Isboseth filium Saul, et circumduxit eum in castra.
verses.english: However, Abner, the son of Ner, who was the commander of Saul's army, took Ishbosheth, Saul's son, and brought him into a fortified camp.

verses.latin: Et constituit eum super Galaad, et super Assurim, et super Jezrael, et super Ephraim, et super Benjamin, et super Israel universum.
verses.english: And he made him king over Gilead, and over the Ashurites, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all of Israel.

verses.latin: Quadraginta annorum erat Isboseth filius Saul, cum regnare cœpisset super Israel, et duobus annis regnavit: sola autem domus Juda sequebatur David.
verses.english: Ishbosheth, Saul's son, was forty years old when he began to reign over Israel, and he reigned for two years. Only the house of Judah followed David.

verses.latin: Et numerus dierum, quibus David regnavit in Hebron super domum Juda, septem anni et sex mensis erant.
verses.english: And the number of days that David reigned in Hebron over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.

verses.latin: Egressus est autem Abner filius Ner, et pueri Isboseth filii Saul de castris in Gabaon.
verses.english: Then Abner, the son of Ner, and the men of Ishbosheth, Saul's son, went out from the fortified camp to Gibeon.

verses.latin: Et Joab filius Sarviæ, et pueri David, egressi sunt de Hebron, et concurrerunt cum eis juxta piscinam Gabaon: et cum in unum locum convenissent, sederunt hi ex hac parte piscinæ, et illi ex altera.
verses.english: And Joab, the son of Zeruiah, and David's men went out from Hebron. They met them by the pool of Gibeon, and when they had gathered in one place, some sat on one side of the pool, and the others sat on the opposite side.

verses.latin: Dixitque Abner ad Joab: Consurgant pueri, et ludant coram nobis. Et respondit Joab: Consurgant.
verses.english: Then Abner said to Joab: "Let the young men rise up and fight before us." And Joab answered: "Let them rise up."

verses.latin: Surrexerunt ergo, et singuli viri quosque David elegerat duodecim, et de Benjamin, et de Isboseth filii Saul duodecim.
verses.english: So they rose up: twelve men chosen by David, and twelve men from Benjamin who fought for Ishbosheth, Saul's son.

verses.latin: Apprehensumque est unumquodque caput, et in adversarium confixit gladium, et corruerunt pariter: appellatumque est nomen loci illius Helcath Assurim, quæ est in Gabaon.
verses.english: And each man grasped his opponent's head and thrust his sword into his adversary, and they all fell down together. So the name of that place was called Helkath Hazzurim, which is in Gibeon.

verses.latin: Et factum est bellum durum nimis in die illa: et cæsus est Abner, et viri Israel a pueris David.
verses.english: And a very fierce battle took place on that day, and Abner and the men of Israel were struck down by David's men.

verses.latin: Erant autem ibi tres filii Sarviæ, Joab, et Abisai, et Asahel: porro Asahel velocissimus cursore, quasi unus de capreis camporum.
verses.english: Now there were three sons of Zeruiah there: Joab, and Abishai, and Asahel. Asahel was as swift of foot as one of the wild gazelles.

verses.latin: Persecutusque est Asahel Abner, et non declinavit ad dexteram sive ad sinistram a tergo Abner.
verses.english: Asahel pursued Abner and did not turn to the right or to the left, following closely behind Abner.

verses.latin: Convertit ergo se Abner respiciens, et ait: Tu es Asahel? Et ille respondit: Ego sum.
verses.english: So Abner turned around, looking back, and said: "Are you Asahel?" And he answered: "I am."

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Abner: Recede post me, et apprehende unum de junioribus, et tolle tibi spolia ejus. Noluitque Asahel relinquere eum, sed ad eum pergebat.
verses.english: And Abner said to him: "Turn away from pursuing me and seize one of the younger men, and take his spoils for yourself." But Asahel would not leave him, but continued to press after him.

verses.latin: Rursumque locutus est Abner ad Asahel, dicens: Recede noli me persequi, ne cogar configere te in terram, et non potero levare faciem meam ad Joab fratrem tuum.
verses.english: Again Abner spoke to Asahel, saying: "Turn away, do not pursue me, lest I be compelled to strike you down to the ground. Then I would not be able to look your brother Joab in the face."

verses.latin: Qui declinare contemnens, percussit eum Abner in inguine sub ascellam, et mortuus est: et omnis qui veniebat ad locum in quo corruerat Asahel et mortuus fuerat, subsistebat.
verses.english: But Asahel, refusing to turn away, was struck by Abner in the stomach, below the armpit, and died there. And everyone who came to the place where Asahel had fallen and died stopped.

verses.latin: Persecuti sunt autem Joab et Abisai Abner: cumque sol occumberet, venerunt ad collem Ammath, qui est ex adverso valli, et viæ deserti Gabaon.
verses.english: Then Joab and Abishai pursued Abner. When the sun was setting, they came to the hill of Ammah, which is opposite the valley and the road to the desert of Gibeon.

verses.latin: Congregati sunt autem filii Benjamin ad Abner: et facti in unum cuneum steterunt in summitate collis.
verses.english: However, the sons of Benjamin gathered together with Abner and formed a single company, standing on the top of a hill.

verses.latin: Et clamavit Abner ad Joab, et ait: Num usque ad internicionem tuus mucro desæviet? an ignoras quoniam periculosa est desperatio? Usquequo non dicis populo ut omittat persequi fratres suos?
verses.english: Then Abner cried out to Joab and said: "Will your sword rage until complete destruction? Do you not know that desperation is dangerous? How long will you not tell the people to stop pursuing their brothers?"

verses.latin: Et ait Joab: Vivit Dominus, si locutus esses, ex mane cessaverat omnis populus persequi fratres suos.
verses.english: And Joab said: "As the Lord lives, if you had spoken, all the people would have stopped pursuing their brothers from early morning."

verses.latin: Et insonuit Joab buccina, et stetit omnis exercitus: et non persecuti sunt ultra Israel, neque ultra pugnaverunt.
verses.english: Then Joab blew the trumpet, and all the army stopped. They no longer pursued Israel, nor did they fight any more.

verses.latin: Abner autem et viri ejus ambulaverunt in planitie tota nocte illa: et transierunt Jordanem, et lustrata universa Bethhoron, venerunt in castra.
verses.english: But Abner and his men marched through the plain all that night. They crossed the Jordan, and after passing through all of Beth-horon, they came to their fortified camp.

verses.latin: Joab quoque reversus, omissa Abner, congregavit omnem exercitum: et defuerunt de pueris David decem et novem viri, absque Asahel.
verses.english: Joab also returned, abandoning the pursuit of Abner, and gathered all the army. Nineteen men from David's followers were missing, besides Asahel.

verses.latin: Servi autem David percusserunt de Benjamin, et de viris Abner, trecentos sexaginta, qui mortui sunt.
verses.english: However, David's men had struck down three hundred and sixty men from Benjamin and from Abner's men, all of whom died.

verses.latin: Tuleruntque Asahel, et sepelierunt eum in sepulchro patris sui in Bethlehem: et ambulaverunt tota nocte Joab et viri ejus, et illuxit eis in Hebron.
verses.english: And they took Asahel and buried him in the tomb of his father in Bethlehem. Then Joab and his men traveled all night, and dawn broke for them in Hebron.

verses.latin: Post haec consuluit David Dominum, dicens: Num ascendam in unam de civitatibus Iuda? Et dixit Dominus ad eum: Ascende. Dixitque David: Quo ascendam? Et dixit Dominus: In Hebron.
verses.english: After these events, David sought guidance from the Lord, asking, 'Should I go up to one of the cities of Judah?' And the Lord spoke to him, saying, 'Go up.' David then asked, 'Where should I go up?' And the Lord said, 'To Hebron.'

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo David, et duae uxores eius, Achinoam Iezraelites, et Abigail uxor Nabal Carmeli.
verses.english: So David went up, along with his two wives: Ahinoam, the woman from Jezreel, and Abigail, the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

verses.latin: Sed et viros qui erant cum eo, duxit David singulos cum domibus suis: et manserunt in civitatibus Hebron.
verses.english: David also brought the men who were with him, each with their own household, and they settled in the various towns within the region of Hebron.

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo viri Iuda, et unxerunt ibi David ut regnaret super domum Iuda. Et nuntiatum est David, quod viri Iabes Galaad sepelissent Saul.
verses.english: Then the men of Judah came and anointed David there to be king over the house of Judah. And it was reported to David that the men of Jabesh-Gilead had buried Saul.

verses.latin: Misit ergo David nuntios ad viros Iabes Galaad, et dixit ad eos: Benedicti vos Domino, qui fecistis misericordiam hanc cum domino vestro Saul, et sepelistis eum.
verses.english: So David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh-Gilead, and said to them: 'May you be blessed by the Lord, you who have shown such loyalty to your lord Saul, by burying him.'

verses.latin: Et nunc retribuet vobis Dominus gratiam et veritatem. Sed et ego reddam vobis bonum, propterea quod fecistis verbum istud.
verses.english: And now, may the Lord repay you with His grace and faithfulness. Indeed, I myself will also reward you with good, because you have done this deed.

verses.latin: Confortentur manus vestrae, et estote filii fortitudinis: quia mortuus est dominus vester Saul: et me unxit domus Iuda in regem sibi.
verses.english: Therefore, strengthen your hands, and be strong, courageous men. For your lord Saul is dead, and the house of Judah has anointed me as their king.

verses.latin: Abner autem filius Ner, princeps exercitus Saul, tulit Isboseth filium Saul, et circumduxit eum per castra,
verses.english: Now Abner, the son of Ner, who was the commander of Saul’s army, took Ishbosheth, Saul’s son, and brought him through the encampments of Israel.

verses.latin: et constituit eum super Galaad, et super Gesuri, et super Iezrahel, et super Ephraim, et super Benjamin, et super universum Israël.
verses.english: And Abner made Ishbosheth king over Gilead, and over the Geshurites, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all of the tribes of Israel outside of Judah.

verses.latin: Quadraginta annorum erat Isboseth filius Saul, cum regnare cœpisset super Israël, et duobus annis regnavit: tantum domus Iuda sequebatur David.
verses.english: Ishbosheth, Saul’s son, was forty years old when he began to reign over Israel, and he reigned for two years. Only the house of Judah followed David.

verses.latin: Et numerus dierum, quibus David regnavit in Hebron super domum Iuda, septem annis et sex mensibus.
verses.english: And the total number of days that David reigned in Hebron over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.

verses.latin: Egressus est autem Abner filius Ner, et cum eo servi Isboseth filii Saul, de Maanaim in Gabaon.
verses.english: Then Abner, the son of Ner, along with the servants of Ishbosheth, Saul’s son, went out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.

verses.latin: Porro Ioab filius Sarviae, et servi David egressi sunt de Hebron, et obviaverunt eis juxta piscinam Gabaon, et simul sederunt, hi ex hac parte, et illi ex illa parte piscinae.
verses.english: And Joab, the son of Zeruiah, along with David’s servants, went out from Hebron. They met Abner and his men by the Pool of Gibeon, and they sat down, some on one side of the pool, and some on the other.

verses.latin: Dixitque Abner ad Ioab: Surgant pueri, et ludant coram nobis. Et respondit Ioab: Surgant.
verses.english: And Abner said to Joab, 'Let the young men rise and play a contest before us.' And Joab responded, 'Let them rise.'

verses.latin: Surrexerunt ergo, et transierunt duodecim de Benjamin, ex parte Isboseth filii Saul, et duodecim de servis David.
verses.english: So they rose and passed over: twelve men from Benjamin, from the side of Ishbosheth, Saul’s son, and twelve of David’s servants.

verses.latin: Apprehenderuntque singuli virum ad caput suum, et verterunt enses in latera eorum, et ceciderunt simul. Et vocatum est nomen loci illius, Campus dolorum, in Gabaon.
verses.english: Each man grabbed his opponent by the head, and they thrust their swords into each other's sides, so they all fell down together and died. And the name of that place was called 'Field of Swords' or 'Field of Sharp Edges' in Gibeon, commemorating this bloody duel.

verses.latin: Et factum est bellum durum nimis in die illa: fugatusque est Abner, et viri Israël a facie servorum David.
verses.english: And a very fierce battle ensued on that day, and Abner and the men of Israel were defeated and fled from David’s servants.

verses.latin: Erant autem ibi tres filii Sarviae, Ioab, et Abisai, et Asael: porro Asael velocissimus pedum, quasi caprea in campis.
verses.english: Now the three sons of Zeruiah were there: Joab, Abishai, and Asahel. And Asahel was as swift of foot as a gazelle in the open fields.

verses.latin: Persecutusque est Asael Abner, et non declinavit ad dexteram vel ad sinistram, abire post Abner.
verses.english: Asahel pursued Abner, and he did not turn to the right or to the left from chasing after Abner.

verses.latin: Respexit ergo Abner post tergum suum, et ait: Tune es Asael? Et ille respondit: Ego sum.
verses.english: So Abner looked back over his shoulder and said, 'Are you Asahel?' And he answered, 'I am.'

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Abner: Recede ad dexteram, sive ad sinistram, et apprehende unum de junioribus, et tolle tibi spolia eius. Noluitque Asael ab eo recedere, et pergebat Abner instantius.
verses.english: And Abner said to him, 'Turn aside to the right or to the left, and seize one of the younger men and take his armor and plunder for yourself.' But Asahel was unwilling to turn back from him, and Abner continued to insist that he stop chasing him.

verses.latin: Rursumque locutus est Abner ad Asael, dicens: Recede noli me persequi, ne cogar configere te in terram, et non potero levare faciem meam ad Ioab fratrem tuum.
verses.english: Abner spoke again to Asahel, saying, 'Stop pursuing me! I do not want to be forced to strike you down to the ground. If I do, how could I ever face your brother Joab again, knowing I killed his brother?'

verses.latin: Qui contemnens audire, noluit declinare: percussit ergo eum Abner a tergo in imo femoris, et transfodit Asael, et mortuus est in eodem loco: et omnes qui transiebant per locum cadaveris Asael, subsistebant.
verses.english: But Asahel disdained to listen and would not turn aside. So Abner struck him in the stomach with the butt-end of his spear, and Asahel was pierced through and died in that very spot. And all who passed by the place where Asahel’s body lay, stopped and gathered there.

verses.latin: Persecuti sunt autem Ioab et Abisai Abner. Sol vero occiderat: et venerunt usque ad collem Amman, qui est ex adverso faciei Gia, et per viam deserti Gabaon.
verses.english: However, Joab and Abishai pursued Abner. And the sun had set when they reached the hill of Ammah, which is opposite Giah, on the way to the wilderness of Gibeon.

verses.latin: Congregati sunt itaque filii Benjamin ad Abner: et facti in unam cohortem, steterunt in vertice tumuli eius.
verses.english: And so the sons of Benjamin gathered together with Abner; they formed one compact fighting unit and took a stand on the top of a small hill.

verses.latin: Et clamavit Abner ad Ioab, et ait: Num usque ad internicionem tuus mucro desæviet? an ignoras quod periculosa sit desperatio? Usquequo non dicis populo, ut omittat persequi fratres suos?
verses.english: And Abner called out to Joab, saying, 'Will your sword rage on to utter destruction forever? Do you not know that desperation is dangerous? How long will it be until you tell the people to stop pursuing their own brothers, the people of Israel?'

verses.latin: Et ait Ioab: Vivit Dominus, si loquutus fuisses, mane vidisset omnis populus quia deseruisset unusquisque a fratre suo.
verses.english: And Joab said, 'As the Lord lives, if you had not spoken up, then by morning all the people would have seen that each man would have abandoned his pursuit of his brother.'

verses.latin: Insonuit ergo Ioab buccina, et stetit omnis exercitus, et non persecuti sunt ultra Israël, neque ultra pugnaverunt.
verses.english: Then Joab sounded the trumpet, and all the army stood still. They no longer pursued Israel, nor did they fight any longer.

verses.latin: Abner autem et viri eius ambulaverunt in planitie tota nocte illa: et transierunt Iordanem, et lustraverunt omnem Bethoron, et venerunt ad Maanaim.
verses.english: But Abner and his men marched through the valley all that night, and they crossed the Jordan River. They journeyed through all of Beth-Horon, and then they came to Mahanaim.

verses.latin: Ioab quoque reversus est, relicto Abner, et congregavit omnem exercitum: defueruntque de servis David decem et novem viri, absque Asael.
verses.english: Joab also returned from pursuing Abner and gathered all the army. And nineteen men were missing from David’s servants, besides Asahel, who was already accounted for.

verses.latin: Servi autem David percusserunt de Benjamin, et de viris Abner, trecentos sexaginta viros, qui mortui sunt.
verses.english: But David’s servants had struck down three hundred and sixty men from Benjamin and from Abner’s men, and all of those men were dead.

verses.latin: Tuleruntque Asael, et sepelierunt eum in sepulchro patris sui in Bethlehem: et ambulaverunt tota nocte Ioab, et viri qui erant cum eo, et illuxit eis in Hebron.
verses.english: Then they took Asahel and buried him in his father’s tomb in Bethlehem. And Joab and the men who were with him marched all night, and the sun rose upon them as they arrived in Hebron.

verses.latin: Fuit ergo bellum longum inter domum Saul et domum David: David quoque proficiscebatur, et confortabatur, domus autem Saul decrescebat quotidie.
verses.english: There was a long war between Saul's royal house and David's royal house. David was making progress and becoming stronger, but Saul's royal house was losing power every day.

verses.latin: Nati sunt autem David filii in Hebron: et fuit primogenitus ejus Amnon, de Achinoam Jezraelitide.
verses.english: Sons were born to David in Hebron. His firstborn was Amnon, born of Ahinoam from Jezreel.

verses.latin: et secundus Cheleab de Abigail uxore Nabal Carmeli: tertius autem Absalom filius Maacha filiae Tholmai regis Gessur.
verses.english: His second son was Chileab, born of Abigail, who had been Nabal the Carmelite's wife. And his third son was Absalom, the son of Maacah, who was the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur.

verses.latin: et quartus Adonias filius Aggith: et quintus Sephatias filius Abital.
verses.english: His fourth son was Adonijah, the son of Haggith. And his fifth son was Shephatiah, the son of Abital.

verses.latin: sextus vero Jethraam de Egla uxore David: hi nati sunt David in Hebron.
verses.english: His sixth son was Ithream, born of Eglah, another of David's wives. These sons were all born to David in Hebron.

verses.latin: Cum ergo esset bellum inter domum Saul et domum David, Abner filius Ner, qui erat dux exercitus Saul, invaluêrat pro domo Saul.
verses.english: During the war between Saul's royal house and David's royal house, Abner, son of Ner, who was the commander of Saul's army, grew very powerful in support of Saul's house.

verses.latin: Fuerat autem Sauli concubina, nomine Respha filia Aja: et dixit Isboseth ad Abner: Quare ingressus es ad concubinam patris mei?
verses.english: Now Saul had a concubine named Rizpah, daughter of Aiah. And Ish-bosheth, Saul's son and successor, asked Abner, "Why did you have relations with my father's concubine?"

verses.latin: Qui iratus nimis propter verba Isboseth, ait: Numquid caput canis ego sum Juda? Hodie ego facio misericordiam super domum Saul patris tui, et super fratres ejus, et super amicos ejus, et non tradidi te in manu David, et tu quæris adversum me quod peccem cum muliere hodie?
verses.english: Abner became very angry over Ish-bosheth's words and responded, "Am I a dog's head from Judah? I am the one showing loyalty to the house of your father Saul today, and to his brothers and his friends, and I have not handed you over to David's power. Yet today you accuse me of a sin concerning a woman?"

verses.latin: Hæc faciat Deus Abner, et hæc addat ei, nisi quemadmodum juravit Dominus David, sic faciam illi.
verses.english: Then Abner swore an oath, saying, "May God do so to Abner, and even more, if I do not act according to what the Lord swore to David and make it happen for him.

verses.latin: Ut transferam regnum de domo Saul, et erigam solium David super Israël et super Judam, a Dan usque ad Bersabee.
verses.english: My goal is to transfer the kingdom from Saul's royal house and establish David's throne over both Israel and Judah, from Dan in the north to Beersheba in the south."

verses.latin: Et non potuit respondere ei quidquam, eo quod timeret eum.
verses.english: Ish-bosheth could not say another word to Abner, because he was afraid of him.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Abner nuntios ad David statim pro se dicens: Cujus est terra? Et dicens: Fac mecum fœdus, et erit manus mea tecum, et reducam ad te universum Israël.
verses.english: So Abner sent messengers to David, on his own behalf, saying, "To whom does the land truly belong?" He also said, "Make a covenant with me, and my hand will be with you, and I will bring all of Israel to you."

verses.latin: Et ait David: Bene: ego faciam tecum fœdus: unam tantum rem postulo a te, dicens: Faciem meam non videbis, nisi prius adduxeris Michol filiam Saul, cum veneris visurus faciem meam.
verses.english: David replied, "Good. I will make a covenant with you, but I demand one thing from you. You will not see my face unless you first bring Michal, Saul's daughter, when you come to see me."

verses.latin: Misit ergo David nuntios ad Isboseth filium Saul, dicens: Redde mihi uxorem meam Michol, quam despondi mihi centum præputiis Philisthinorum.
verses.english: David then sent messengers to Ish-bosheth, Saul's son, saying, "Return my wife Michal to me, whom I acquired as my betrothed by providing one hundred foreskins of the Philistines."

verses.latin: Misit ergo Isboseth, et tulit eam a viro suo Phaltiel filio Lais.
verses.english: So Ish-bosheth sent men and took her away from her husband, Paltiel, the son of Laish.

verses.latin: Flebat autem et sequebatur eam vir ejus a Bahurim: et dixit ad Abner: Vade, et revertere. Et reversus est.
verses.english: Her husband followed her, weeping, all the way to Bahurim. But Abner said to him, "Go back now; turn around." And so he went back.

verses.latin: Sermo quoque Abner factus est ad seniores Israël dicens: Jampridem quærebatis David, ut regnaret super vos.
verses.english: Abner had also spoken to the elders of Israel, saying, "For a long time now, you have desired David to reign over you.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo facite: quoniam Dominus locutus est ad David, dicens: In manu servi mei David salvabo populum meum Israël de manu Philisthinorum, et omnium inimicorum ejus.
verses.english: Now therefore, act upon it. For the Lord has spoken concerning David, saying, 'By the hand of my servant David, I will save my people Israel from the hand of the Philistines and from all their enemies.'"

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Abner etiam ad Benjamin: et abiit ad David in Hebron, ut loqueretur ei omnia quæ placuerant Israeli, et universæ domui Benjamin.
verses.english: Abner also spoke directly to the tribe of Benjamin. Then he went to David in Hebron to report everything that pleased Israel and the entire house of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Venit ergo Abner ad David in Hebron, et viginti viri cum eo: et fecit David Abner, et viris qui cum eo venerant, convivium.
verses.english: So Abner came to David in Hebron with twenty men. And David prepared a feast for Abner and the men who had come with him.

verses.latin: Et ait Abner ad David: Surgam, et congregabo ad te, domine mi rex, universum Israël, ut ineant tecum fœdus, et imperes omnibus sicut desiderat anima tua. Et dimisit David Abner, et abiit in pace.
verses.english: Abner said to David, "I will rise and gather all Israel to you, my lord the king, so that they may make a covenant with you, and you may rule over all of them, just as your heart desires." Then David sent Abner away, and he departed in peace.

verses.latin: Et statim pueri David, et Joab, venientes cum magna præda de excursionibus, repererunt Abner in Hebron: siquidem dimiserat eum David, et abierat in pace.
verses.english: Just as David's servants and Joab returned from a successful raid, bringing much plunder, they found that Abner was no longer in Hebron. Indeed, David had sent him away, and he had departed in peace.

verses.latin: Ingressusque Joab ad regem, ait: Quid fecisti? ecce Abner venit ad te: quare dimisisti eum, et abiit?
verses.english: Joab went in to the king and said, "What have you done? Look, Abner came to you; why did you let him leave and depart?

verses.latin: Nescis Abner filium Ner, quia ad hoc venit ad te, ut decipiat te, et sciat exitum tuum, et introitum tuum, et omnia quæ agis?
verses.english: You don't know Abner, son of Ner, that he came to you only to deceive you, to find out your movements, your comings and goings, and everything you are doing?"

verses.latin: Et egressus Joab a David, misit nuntios post Abner, et reduxit eum de cisterna Siram, nesciente David.
verses.english: And Joab, having left David's presence, sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the cistern of Sirah, without David knowing it.

verses.latin: Cumque reversus esset Abner in Hebron, seorsum abduxit eum Joab de porta, quasi ut loqueretur ei quidpiam, et percussit eum ibi in latere, et mortuus est, pro sanguine Asahel fratris sui.
verses.english: When Abner returned to Hebron, Joab led him aside to the gate, as if to speak to him privately, and there he struck him in the side, and he died. This was for the blood of Asahel, Joab's brother, whom Abner had killed in battle.

verses.latin: Audivit autem David post hæc, et ait: Mundus ego sum, et regnum meum a Domino usque in sempiternum, a sanguine Abner filii Ner:
verses.english: After this, David heard the news and declared, "I am innocent, and my kingdom is innocent before the Lord forever, of the blood of Abner, son of Ner.

verses.latin: et veniat super caput Joab, et super omnem domum patris ejus: et non deficiat de domo Joab fluxum seminis, et leprosum, et tenentem fusum, et cadentem gladio, et panem non habentem.
verses.english: May his blood come upon the head of Joab and upon all his father's house. May there never cease from Joab's house someone with a discharge, or a leper, or one who holds a spindle (a woman's work, implying weakness), or one who falls by the sword, or one who lacks bread."

verses.latin: Igitur Joab, et Abisai frater ejus, interfecerunt Abner, eo quod interfector esset Asahel fratris eorum in Gabaon prælio.
verses.english: So Joab and Abishai, his brother, killed Abner because he had killed Asahel, their brother, in the battle at Gibeon.

verses.latin: Præcepit ergo David Joab, et omni populo qui erat cum eo, scindite vestimenta vestra, et accingimini ciliciis, et plangite ante faciem Abner. Porro rex David sequebatur feretrum.
verses.english: Then David commanded Joab and all the people who were with him, "Tear your clothes, put on sackcloth, and mourn before Abner." And King David himself followed the bier.

verses.latin: Sepelieruntque Abner in Hebron: et levavit rex vocem suam, et flevit super sepulcrum Abner: flevit autem et omnis populus.
verses.english: They buried Abner in Hebron. The king raised his voice and wept at Abner's tomb. And all the people also wept.

verses.latin: Confortatusque omnis populus ut comederet panem cum David, et juravit David dicens: Hæc faciat mihi Deus, et hæc addat, si ante occasum solis gustavero panem vel quidquam aliud.
verses.english: And all the people tried to persuade David to eat some food. But David swore an oath, saying, "May God do so to me, and even more, if I taste bread or anything else before the sun sets."

verses.latin: Et cognovit universus populus, et placuit illis: sicut enim omnia quæcumque fecerat rex in conspectu omnis populi, placuerant.
verses.english: All the people took notice of this, and they were pleased. For everything the king did was pleasing in the sight of all the people.

verses.latin: Et cognoverunt cuncti populi, et omnis Israël in die illa, quoniam non a rege factum fuerat ut occideretur Abner filius Ner.
verses.english: And all the people and all Israel understood that day that the king had not been responsible for the killing of Abner, son of Ner.

verses.latin: Flevit autem rex ad servos suos: Nescitis quia princeps, et maximus cecidit hodie in Israël?
verses.english: The king said to his servants, weeping, "Do you not know that a prince, a very great man, has fallen this day in Israel?"

verses.latin: Me quoque hodie molles et teneri sumus, et principes a Deo uncti: his autem viris durior est sermo: retribuat Dominus facienti malum juxta malitiam suam.
verses.english: David continued, "Even though I am anointed by God, I feel weak and vulnerable today, and these men, the sons of Zeruiah, are too severe for me. May the Lord repay the evildoer according to his wickedness."

verses.latin: Et cognovit omnis populus et universus Israël in die illa quia non a rege factum fuerat ut occideretur Abner filius Ner.
verses.english: And all the people and all Israel knew that day that it was not by the king's doing that Abner, son of Ner, was killed.

verses.latin: Dixerat quoque rex ad servos suos: Nescitis quoniam princeps et maximus cecidit hodie in Israël?
verses.english: The king had also said to his servants, "Do you not know that a prince and a great man has fallen today in Israel?"

verses.latin: Porro ego hodie delicatus et unctus sum rex: hi quoque viri filii Sarviæ duri sunt mihi: retribuat Dominus facienti malum juxta malitiam suam.
verses.english: Furthermore, I am delicate (vulnerable) today, though I am an anointed king. And these men, the sons of Zeruiah, are too harsh for me. May the Lord repay the one who does evil according to his wickedness.

verses.latin: Fuit ergo proelium longum inter domum Saul et inter domum David. David quoque proficiebat et semper fortior fiebat, domus autem Saul decrescebat quotidie.
verses.english: So there was a long war between the royal house of Saul and the royal house of David. David grew in strength and became ever more powerful, while the house of Saul weakened daily.

verses.latin: Nati sunt autem David filii in Hebron: et fuit primogenitus ejus Amnon de Achinoam Jezraelitide:
verses.english: Sons were born to David in Hebron. His firstborn was Amnon, born from Ahinoam, the Jezreelitess.

verses.latin: et secundus Cheleab de Abigail uxore Nabal Carmeli: tertius autem Absalom filius Tholmai regis Gessur de Maacha:
verses.english: His second son was Chileab, born from Abigail, Nabal the Carmelite's widow. His third son was Absalom, born from Maacah, who was the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur.

verses.latin: et quartus Adonias filius Aggith: et quintus Sephatias filius Abital:
verses.english: His fourth son was Adonijah, born from Haggith. His fifth son was Shephatiah, born from Abital.

verses.latin: et sextus Jethraam de Egla uxore David: hi nati sunt David in Hebron.
verses.english: And his sixth son was Ithream, born from Eglah, another one of David's wives. These sons were all born to David in Hebron, while he reigned there.

verses.latin: Cum ergo fieret proelium inter domum Saul et inter domum David, Abner filius Ner, qui erat dux exercitus Saul, infortius versabatur pro domo Saul.
verses.english: While the war was ongoing between the house of Saul and the house of David, Abner, son of Ner, who was the commander of Saul's army, acted with increasing defiance on behalf of Saul's house.

verses.latin: Fuerat autem Saul concubina nomine Respha filia Aja. Dixitque Isboseth ad Abner: Quare ingressus es ad concubinam patris mei?
verses.english: Now Saul had had a concubine named Rizpah, daughter of Aiah. And Ish-bosheth accused Abner, saying, "Why did you sleep with my father's concubine? That makes you a claimant to his throne."

verses.latin: Et iratus est Abner valde propter verba Isboseth, et ait: Numquid caput canis ego sum ad versus Judam hodie, qui fecerim misericordiam super domum Saul patris tui, et super fratres, et super proximos ejus, et non tradidi te in manu David? et tu queris adversum me quod hodie peccaverim cum muliere?
verses.english: Abner became extremely angry because of Ish-bosheth's words and responded, "Am I a dog's head, deserving of such an insult? This very day I am loyal to Judah! I have shown mercy to the house of your father Saul, and to his brothers and kinsmen, and I haven't handed you over to David's control! Yet you accuse me today of a sin with a woman?"

verses.latin: Hæc faciat Deus Abner et hæc addat ei, nisi quemadmodum juravit Dominus David, sic faciam illi:
verses.english: Abner swore an oath, saying, "May God do this to Abner, and more also, if I do not act exactly as the Lord swore to David."

verses.latin: ut transferatur regnum de domo Saul, et elevetur thronus David super Israel et super Judam, a Dan usque Bersabee.
verses.english: "That is, I will transfer the kingdom from the house of Saul and establish David's throne over all of Israel and Judah, from Dan in the north to Beersheba in the south."

verses.latin: Et non potuit respondere Isboseth quicquam Abner, eo quod timeret eum.
verses.english: Ish-bosheth could not answer Abner a single word because he was afraid of him.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Abner nuntios ad David statim pro se dicentes: Cujus est terra? et ut faceret secum fœdus, et: Ecce, manus mea tecum est, ut convertam ad te universum Israel.
verses.english: So Abner immediately sent messengers to David, saying on his own behalf, "To whom does the land truly belong? Make a covenant with me, and behold, I am ready to help you turn all of Israel over to your rule."

verses.latin: Dixitque David: Bene: ego faciam tecum fœdus, unam tamen rem postulo a te, dicens: faciem meam non videbis, nisi prius adduxeris Michol filiam Saul, cum veneris visurus faciem meam.
verses.english: David replied, "Good, I will make a covenant with you. But I demand one thing from you: you will not see my face unless you first bring Michal, Saul's daughter, when you come to see me."

verses.latin: Misit quoque David nuntios ad Isboseth filium Saul, dicens: Redde mihi uxorem meam Michol, quam despondi mihi centum præputiis Philisthinorum.
verses.english: David also sent messengers to Ish-bosheth, Saul's son, saying, "Give me back my wife Michal, whom I betrothed to myself for the price of one hundred Philistine foreskins."

verses.latin: Misit ergo Isboseth, et tulit eam de viro suo Paltiel filio Lais.
verses.english: So Ish-bosheth sent for her and took her away from her husband, Paltiel, son of Laish.

verses.latin: Sequebatur autem eam vir suus flens et vadens usque Bahurim: et dixit ad eum Abner: Vade, et revertere. Qui reversus est.
verses.english: Her husband followed her, weeping as he went, all the way to Bahurim. Abner said to him, "Go back!" So he returned.

verses.latin: Sermonem quoque habuit Abner cum senioribus Israel, dicens: Tam heri quam nudiustertius quærebatis David ut regnaret super vos.
verses.english: Abner also spoke to the elders of Israel, saying, "Both yesterday and the day before, you were seeking to have David reign over you."

verses.latin: Nunc ergo facite: quoniam Dominus locutus est ad David, dicens: In manu David servi mei salvabo populum meum Israel de manu Philisthinorum, et omnium inimicorum eorum.
verses.english: "Now therefore, act upon it, for the Lord has spoken concerning David, saying, 'By the hand of My servant David I will save My people Israel from the hand of the Philistines and from the hand of all their enemies.'"

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Abner etiam ad Benjamin: et abiit ut loqueretur ad David in Hebron omnia quæ placuerant Israeli et universo Benjamin.
verses.english: Abner also spoke to the tribe of Benjamin. Then he went to speak to David in Hebron, conveying all that had pleased Israel and the entire tribe of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Venit itaque Abner ad David in Hebron, et viginti viri cum eo: et fecit David Abner et viris qui cum eo venerant, convivium.
verses.english: So Abner came to David in Hebron, with twenty men accompanying him. David held a feast for Abner and the men who had come with him.

verses.latin: Et dixit Abner ad David: Surgam, et congregabo ad te, domine mi rex, omnem Israel, ut feriant tecum fœdus, et imperes omnibus, sicut desiderat anima tua. Et dimisit David Abner, et abiit in pace.
verses.english: Abner said to David, "I will go now and gather all Israel to you, my lord the king, so that they may make a covenant with you, and you may rule over all of them, just as your heart desires." David then sent Abner away, and he departed in peace.

verses.latin: Et ecce servi David et Joab, venientes de præda, adduxerunt secum spolia multa: Abner vero jam non erat cum David in Hebron, quia dimiserat eum, et abierat in pace.
verses.english: Just then, David's servants and Joab returned from a raid, bringing many spoils with them. Abner, however, was no longer with David in Hebron, because David had sent him away, and he had departed in peace.

verses.latin: Ingressoque Joab, nuntiaverunt ei, dicentes: Venit Abner filius Ner ad regem, et dimisit eum, et abiit in pace.
verses.english: When Joab arrived, he was told, "Abner, son of Ner, came to the king, and the king sent him away, and he departed in peace."

verses.latin: Et introivit Joab ad regem, et ait: Quid fecisti? ecce, Abner venit ad te: quare dimisisti eum, et abiit, et recessit?
verses.english: Joab went in to the king and asked, "What have you done? Look, Abner came to you! Why did you send him away so that he just left?"

verses.latin: Ignoras Abner filium Ner, quia ad hoc venit ad te ut decipiat te, et sciat exitum tuum et introitum tuum, et omnia quæ agis?
verses.english: "Don't you know Abner, son of Ner? He came to you only to deceive you, to learn your coming and going, and to discover all your plans."

verses.latin: Cumque egressus esset Joab a David, misit nuntios post Abner, et reduxit eum de cisterna Siram, nesciente David.
verses.english: After Joab left David, he sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the well of Sirah, but David did not know about it.

verses.latin: Cumque reduxsisset Abner in Hebron, seorsum abduxit eum Joab de porta, ut loqueretur ei occulte: et percussit eum ibi in inguine, et mortuus est, in ultionem sanguinis Asaël fratris sui.
verses.english: When Abner returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside inside the gate, as if to speak to him privately. There, Joab stabbed him in the stomach, and he died, in revenge for the blood of Asahel, Joab's brother.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset David postea, ait: Mundus ego et regnum meum a sanguine Abner filii Ner coram Domino usque in sempiternum.
verses.english: When David heard of it afterward, he declared, "I and my kingdom are innocent before the Lord forever concerning the blood of Abner, son of Ner."

verses.latin: Cadat in caput Joab et in omnem domum patris ejus: et non sit qui deficiat de domo Joab a fluxu et a lepra, et tenens fusum, et cadens gladio, et indigens pane.
verses.english: "May the guilt for Abner's death fall upon the head of Joab and upon all his father's house. May the house of Joab never lack someone afflicted with a discharge, or a leper, or one who holds a distaff, or one who falls by the sword, or one who lacks bread."

verses.latin: Joab ergo et Abisai frater ejus interfecerunt Abner, eo quod interfector fratris sui Asaël fuisset in Gabaon in prælio.
verses.english: So Joab and his brother Abishai killed Abner because Abner had killed their brother Asahel in battle at Gibeon.

verses.latin: Præcepit autem David Joab, et omni populo qui erat cum eo, dicens: Scindite vestimenta vestra, et accingimini saccis, et plangite ante Abner. Porro rex David sequebatur feretrum.
verses.english: Then David commanded Joab and all the people who were with him, saying, "Tear your clothes, put on sackcloth, and mourn before Abner." And King David himself followed the bier.

verses.latin: Cumque sepelissent Abner in Hebron, levavit rex vocem suam, et flevit super sepulchrum Abner: flevit et omnis populus.
verses.english: When they had buried Abner in Hebron, the king lifted his voice and wept at Abner's tomb. All the people also wept.

verses.latin: Lamentansque rex et dicens: Neque ut murio moritur Abner,
verses.english: And the king lamented and said, "Should Abner have died like a fool?"

verses.latin: manus tuæ ligatæ non fuerunt, et pedes tui non compediti: sed sicut cadere solent impii corruisti, ante filios iniquitatis. Flevitque super eum omnis populus.
verses.english: "Your hands were not bound, nor your feet shackled. You fell as a wicked man falls, before treacherous men." And all the people wept over him again.

verses.latin: Cumque venisset universus populus ut cibaret David pane, cum adhuc esset dies, juravit David dicens: Hæc faciat mihi Deus et hæc addat, si ante solis occubitum gustavero panem vel quidquam aliud.
verses.english: All the people came to offer David food while it was still daylight, but David swore an oath, saying, "May God do this to me and more also, if I taste bread or anything else before the sun sets."

verses.latin: Et cognovit omnis populus, et placuit eis: sicut enim omnia quæcunque fecit rex, placuerunt in conspectu universi populi.
verses.english: All the people understood this, and it pleased them; indeed, everything the king did was pleasing in the sight of all the people.

verses.latin: Et scivit universus populus et omnis Israel in die illa, quoniam non fuerat a rege ut occideretur Abner filius Ner.
verses.english: So all the people and all of Israel understood that day that the killing of Abner, son of Ner, had not been the king's doing.

verses.latin: Dixit quoque rex ad servos suos: Nescitis quia princeps et maximus cecidit hodie in Israel?
verses.english: The king also said to his servants, "Do you not know that a prince and a great man has fallen this day in Israel?"

verses.latin: Ego autem adhuc delicatus et unctus rex: porro viri isti filii Sarviæ duri sunt super me: retribuat Dominus facienti malum juxta malitiam suam.
verses.english: "And though I am still weak and newly anointed as king, these men, the sons of Zeruiah, are too harsh for me to control. May the Lord repay the evil-doer according to his wickedness."

verses.latin: Audivit autem filius Saul Isbaal, quod cecidisset Abner in Hebron: et dissolutae sunt manus ejus, et omnis Israel conturbatus est.
verses.english: When Saul's son, Ishbaal, heard that Abner had died in Hebron, he lost all courage, and all of Israel was troubled by this news.

verses.latin: Duo autem viri principes latronum erant filio Saul: nomen uni Baana, et nomen alteri Rechab, filii Remmon Berothitae de filiis Benjamin: siquidem et Beroth reputata est in Benjamin.
verses.english: Now, Saul's son had two captains of his raiding bands: one was named Baanah, and the other was Rechab. They were sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, of the tribe of Benjamin; Beeroth itself was also considered part of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Fugerant enim Berothitae in Getthaim, et fuerunt ibi advenae usque in illud tempus.
verses.english: The Beerothites had fled to Gittaim and lived there as foreign residents up until that time.

verses.latin: Erat autem Jonathae filio Saul filius debilis pedibus: quinquennis enim erat quando venit nuntius de Saul et Jonathan ex Jezrahel: sublataque nutrix ejus portabat illum: et cum festinaret ut fugeret, cecidit, et claudus effectus est: et nomen ejus Miphiboseth.
verses.english: Now, Jonathan, Saul's son, had a son who was lame in his feet. He was five years old when the news came from Jezreel about Saul and Jonathan. His nurse picked him up and carried him, but as she hurried to flee, she fell, and he became lame. His name was Mephibosheth.

verses.latin: Igitur pergentes filii Remmon Berothitae Rechab et Baana, venerunt in aestu diei in domum Isbaal: qui dormiebat super stratum suum meridie.
verses.english: So Rechab and Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, went and came to Ishbaal's house during the heat of the day. Ishbaal was sleeping on his bed at noon.

verses.latin: Et ecce ostiaria domus purgans triticum, obdormivit: illi vero, per ostium occulte illata manu, et percusserunt eum in inguine, et fugerunt.
verses.english: And behold, the doorkeeper of the house, who was cleaning wheat, had fallen asleep. So these men, secretly bringing in their hands through the doorway, struck him in the stomach and fled.

verses.latin: Cum enim ingressi fuissent domum, ille dormiebat super lectulum suum in conclavi: et percutientes interfecerunt eum: sublatoque capite ejus abierunt per viam deserti tota nocte.
verses.english: For when they had entered the house, he was sleeping on his bed in the inner chamber. They struck him and killed him. Then they took his head and went away by the desert road all night long.

verses.latin: Et attulerunt caput Isbaal ad David in Hebron, dixeruntque ad regem: Ecce caput Isbaal filii Saul inimici tui, qui quærebat animam tuam: et dedit Dominus Domino nostro regi ultionem hodie de Saul et de semine ejus.
verses.english: They brought the head of Ishbaal to David in Hebron and said to the king: 'Behold, here is the head of Ishbaal, son of Saul, your enemy, who sought to kill you. The Lord has today given our lord the king vengeance on Saul and his descendants.'

verses.latin: Et respondens David Rechab et Baana fratri ejus, filiis Remmon Berothitae, dixit ad eos: Vivit Dominus, qui eruit animam meam de omni angustia,
verses.english: But David answered Rechab and his brother Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said to them: 'As the Lord lives, who has rescued my life from all distress—'

verses.latin: quoniam eum qui annuntiaverat mihi, dicens: Mortuus est Saul, qui putabat se prospera nuntiare, tenui et occidi in Siceleg, cui oportuerat mercedem dare pro nuntio:
verses.english: '—when someone told me that Saul was dead, thinking he was bringing good news, I seized him and killed him in Ziklag. That man thought he deserved a reward for his message!'

verses.latin: quanto magis nunc, scelerati homines interfecerunt virum justum in domo sua super lectulum suum? nunc ergo sanguinem ejus de manu vestra requiram, et auferam vos de terra.
verses.english: 'How much more then should I punish you, wicked men, who have killed a righteous man in his own house, on his own bed? Therefore, I will now demand his blood from your hands and remove you from the earth.'

verses.latin: Et præcepit David pueris suis, et interfecerunt illos: præcidentesque manus et pedes eorum, suspenderunt eos super piscinam in Hebron: caput vero Isbaal tulerunt, et sepelierunt in sepulchro Abner in Hebron.
verses.english: Then David commanded his young men, and they killed them. They cut off their hands and feet and hung their bodies over the pool in Hebron. But they took Ishbaal's head and buried it in Abner's tomb in Hebron.

verses.latin: Audivit autem Isboseth filius Saul quod cecidisset Abner in Hebron et dissolutae sunt manus ejus et cunctus Israel turbatus est.
verses.english: But Ishbosheth, who was Saul’s son, heard the news that Abner had been killed in Hebron. Ishbosheth then became utterly powerless to act, and all of Israel became fearful and in turmoil.

verses.latin: Duoque viri principes latronum erant filio Saul, quorum alter Baana nomine et alter Rechab filii Remmon Berothitae de filiis Benjamin: siquidem et Beroth reputata est in Benjamin.
verses.english: Now, two men who were commanders of raiding parties were serving Saul’s son. One was named Baanah and the other Rechab; they were the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, of the tribe of Benjamin—for Beeroth was also accounted as part of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et fugerant Berothitae in Getthaim et fuerunt ibi advenae usque in illam diem.
verses.english: The Beerothites had fled to Gittaim and had lived there as foreigners up until that very day.

verses.latin: Erat autem Jonathae filio Saul filius debilis pedibus: quinquennis enim fuit quando venit nuntius de Saul et Jonathan ex Jezrahel: sublatoque eo nutrix sua fugit et cum festinaret ut fugeret cecidit et claudus effectus est: et nomen ejus erat Meribbaal.
verses.english: Jonathan, Saul’s son, had a son who was disabled in his feet. He was five years old when the news came from Jezreel about Saul and Jonathan’s deaths. His nurse picked him up and fled, but as she hurried to escape, he fell and became lame. His name was Meribbaal.

verses.latin: Igitur profecti sunt filii Remmon Berothitae Rechab et Baana et ingressi domum Isboseth fervente die ipso cum dormiret somno meridiano.
verses.english: So, Rechab and Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, set out and went into Ishbosheth’s house during the heat of the day, while he was taking his noonday nap.

verses.latin: Et ecce janitrix domus purgans triticum obdormivit: ingressique sunt clam et Rechab et Baana frater ejus et percusserunt eum in inguine et fugerunt.
verses.english: And behold, the woman who guarded the entrance to the house was sifting wheat and had fallen asleep. So, Rechab and his brother Baanah secretly entered, struck Ishbosheth in the stomach, and then fled.

verses.latin: Cum autem ingressi fuissent domum ille dormiebat super stratum suum in conclavi et percusserunt eum et interfecerunt sublatoque capite ejus abierunt per viam deserti tota nocte.
verses.english: Indeed, when they had entered the house, Ishbosheth was sleeping on his bed in his inner chamber. They struck him and killed him. Then, taking his head, they departed by way of the desert road throughout the entire night.

verses.latin: Attuleruntque caput Isboseth ad David in Hebron et dixerunt ad regem: Ecce caput Isboseth filii Saul inimici tui qui quarebat animam tuam: ut retribueret Dominus domino meo regi de Saul et de semine ejus.
verses.english: They brought Ishbosheth’s head to David in Hebron and said to the king, “Behold, here is the head of Ishbosheth, the son of Saul, your enemy, who sought your life. Today, the Lord has granted vengeance to my lord the king against Saul and his descendants.”

verses.latin: Et respondens David Rechab et Baana fratri ejus filiis Remmon Berothitae dixit ad eos: Vivit Dominus qui eruit animam meam de omni angustia.
verses.english: David answered Rechab and his brother Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said to them, “As the Lord lives, who has delivered my soul from all distress and trouble—”

verses.latin: Quoniam eum qui annuntiaverat mihi dicens: Mortuus est Saul qui putabat se prospera nuntiare tenui et occidi in Siceleg cui dare debueram mercedem pro nuntio.
verses.english: “—for the man who announced to me that Saul was dead, thinking he was bringing good news, I seized him and killed him in Ziklag. I should have given him a reward for his message, but instead, he died for it.”

verses.latin: Quanto igitur magis nunc cum homines scelerati interfecerunt virum justum in domo sua super stratum suum non quaeram sanguinem ejus de manu vestra et auferam vos de terra.
verses.english: “How much more, then, when wicked men have murdered an innocent man in his own home, on his own bed, shall I not demand his blood from your hands and utterly remove you from the face of the earth?”

verses.latin: Præcepit itaque David pueris suis et interfecerunt eos praecideruntque manus et pedes eorum et suspenderunt illos super piscinam in Hebron: caput vero Isboseth tulerunt et sepelierunt in sepulcro Abner in Hebron.
verses.english: So David commanded his young men, and they executed them. They cut off their hands and feet and hung their bodies by the pool in Hebron. But Ishbosheth’s head they took and buried in Abner’s tomb in Hebron.

verses.latin: Venerunt omnes tribus Israel ad David in Hebron, dicentes: Ecce nos sumus os tuum et caro tua.
verses.english: All the tribes of Israel gathered with David in Hebron, and they said: "Look, we are your own kin—your bone and your flesh."

verses.latin: Sed et heri et nudiustertius, cum esset Saul rex super nos, tu eras educens et reducens Israel: et tibi locutus est Dominus: Tu pasces populum meum Israel, et tu eris dux super Israel.
verses.english: Even before now, and for some time past, when Saul was king over us, you were the one who led Israel into battle and brought them back safely. And the Lord Himself spoke to you, saying: "You will shepherd My people, Israel, and you will be a leader over Israel."

verses.latin: Venerunt quoque et omnes seniores Israel ad regem in Hebron, percussitque rex David foedus cum eis in Hebron coram Domino: unxeruntque David regem super Israel.
verses.english: Then all the elders of Israel also came to King David in Hebron. And King David made a covenant with them in Hebron, in the presence of the Lord. And they anointed David as king over all Israel.

verses.latin: Quadraginta annorum erat David cum regnare coepisset, et quadraginta annis regnavit.
verses.english: David was forty years old when he began his reign, and he reigned for forty years in total.

verses.latin: In Hebron septem annis et sex mensibus regnavit super Judam: in Jerusalem triginta tribus annis regnavit super omnem Israel et Judam.
verses.english: In Hebron, David reigned over Judah alone for seven years and six months. Then in Jerusalem, he reigned for thirty-three years over both all of Israel and Judah.

verses.latin: Et abiit rex et omnes viri qui erant cum eo, in Jerusalem ad Jebusaeum habitatorem terrae: dictumque est a Jebusaeis ad David: Non ingredieris huc, nisi abstuleris caecos et claudos, dicentes: Non ingredietur David huc.
verses.english: Then the king and all the men who were with him went to Jerusalem, where the Jebusites lived. And the Jebusites said to David: "You will not enter here unless you defeat even the blind and the lame." They were taunting David by saying: "David will not be able to enter here!"

verses.latin: Cepit autem David arcem Sion, haec est civitas David.
verses.english: But David captured the stronghold of Zion. This stronghold later became known as the City of David.

verses.latin: Dixit enim David in die illa: Omnis qui percusserit Jebusaeum, ascendat per fistulas aquarum, et contingat paralyticos et caecos et odio habentes animam David: propterea dicitur in proverbio: Caecus et claudus non intrabunt in templum.
verses.english: For David had said on that day: "Whoever is able to strike down the Jebusites, let him go up through the water shaft to reach these lame and blind ones who so hate David's soul." Because of this, it is said in a proverb: "The blind and the lame will not enter the house of the Lord." The Jebusites' taunt came back to bite them.

verses.latin: Habitavit itaque David in arce, et vocavit eam civitatem David: et aedificavit David in circuitu a Mello et intrinsecus.
verses.english: So David lived in the stronghold and called it the City of David. And David built up the city around it, from the Millo—a defensive structure—inward.

verses.latin: Et proficiebat David crescens et magnificabatur, et Dominus Deus exercituum erat cum eo.
verses.english: And David continued to prosper and grew ever more powerful, because the Lord, the God of all creation and armies, was with him.

verses.latin: Misit quoque Hiram rex Tyri nuntios ad David, et ligna cedrina, et fabri lignorum et artifices lapidum, et aedificaverunt domum David.
verses.english: Hiram, the king of Tyre, also sent messengers to David, along with cedar timber, and carpenters and stonemasons. And they built a royal palace for David.

verses.latin: Et cognovit David quoniam confirmasset eum Dominus regem super Israel, et quoniam exaltasset regnum suum super populum suum Israel.
verses.english: And David knew with certainty that the Lord had firmly established him as king over all Israel, and that He had greatly exalted David's kingdom over His own people, Israel.

verses.latin: Accepit quoque David uxores et concubinas de Jerusalem, postquam venerat de Hebron: natique sunt ei filii et filiae.
verses.english: After David had come from Hebron to Jerusalem, he also took more wives and concubines from Jerusalem, and sons and daughters were born to him there.

verses.latin: Et haec nomina eorum qui nati sunt ei in Jerusalem: Sammua et Sobab et Nathan et Salomon,
verses.english: And these are the names of the children who were born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,

verses.latin: Ibhar quoque et Elisua et Nepheg et Japhia,
verses.english: Also Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, and Japhia,

verses.latin: Et Elisama et Elioda et Eliphaleth.
verses.english: And Elishama, Elioda, and Eliphalet.

verses.latin: Audierunt autem Philisthiim quod unxissent David regem super Israel, et ascenderunt omnes Philisthiim ad quaerendum David: quod cum audisset David, descendit in praesidium.
verses.english: Now the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over Israel, and all the Philistines went up to seek out David for battle. When David heard this, he went down to a secure defensive position.

verses.latin: Philisthiim autem venientes, diffusi sunt in Valle Raphaim.
verses.english: But the Philistines came and spread out through the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.latin: Et consuluit David Dominum, dicens: Si ascendam ad Philisthiim, et si dabis eos in manu mea? Et respondit Dominus ad David: Ascende, quia dando dabo Philisthiim in manu tua.
verses.english: And David consulted the Lord, saying: "Should I go up against the Philistines? Will You give them into my hand?" And the Lord answered David: "Go up, for I will certainly give the Philistines into your hand."

verses.latin: Venit ergo David in Baal Pharisim: et percussit ibi David Philisthiim, dixitque: Divisit Dominus inimicos meos coram me, sicut dividuntur aquae: propterea vocatum est nomen loci illius, Baal Pharisim.
verses.english: So David came to Baal Perazim, and David struck down the Philistines there. Then David said: "The Lord has broken through my enemies before me, just as a powerful flood breaks through a barrier." Therefore, the name of that place was called Baal Perazim, meaning "Lord of Breakings Through."

verses.latin: Et dimiserunt ibi vestimenta sua, quae tulit David et viri ejus.
verses.english: And the Philistines abandoned their idols there, which David and his men then carried away.

verses.latin: Et rursum ascenderunt Philisthiim, et diffusi sunt in Valle Raphaim.
verses.english: But the Philistines came up again, and once more they spread out through the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.latin: Et consuluit David Dominum: qui respondit: Non ascendam contra eos, sed gyrabis post tergum eorum, et venies illis ex adverso pirorum.
verses.english: And David consulted the Lord again, who answered: "You shall not attack them directly. Instead, circle around behind them, and come at them from the direction of the mulberry trees."

verses.latin: Et cum audieris sonitum gradientis in vertice pirorum, tunc inies praelium: quia tunc egredietur Dominus ante faciem tuam, ut percutiat castra Philisthiim.
verses.english: And when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, that will be your signal to launch the attack. For then the Lord Himself will go out before you to strike down the camp of the Philistines.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo David sicut praeceperat ei Dominus, et percussit Philisthiim de Geba, donec venias in Gezer.
verses.english: So David did exactly as the Lord had commanded him, and he struck down the Philistines, driving them from Geba all the way to Gezer.

verses.latin: Venerunt itaque universi videntes de stirpe Israël ad David in Hebron, dicentes: Ecce nos os tuum, et caro tua sumus.
verses.english: So all the leaders and representatives from the tribes of Israel came to David in Hebron, saying to him, 'Look, we are your own flesh and blood, your very kin.'

verses.latin: Sed et heri et nudius tertius, cum adhuc esset Saul rex super nos, tu eras educens et reducens Israël: et dixit Dominus ad te: Tu pasces populum meum Israël, et tu eris dux super Israël.
verses.english: Even before this, when Saul was still king over us, you were the one who led the people of Israel in and out of battle. And the Lord God himself said to you: 'You will shepherd My people Israel, and you will be their true leader.'

verses.latin: Venerunt quoque et omnes maiores natu de Israël ad regem in Hebron, et percissit David cum eis fœdus in Hebron coram Domino: unxeruntque David regem super Israël.
verses.english: Therefore, all the elders of Israel also came to King David in Hebron. And David made a solemn covenant with them there in Hebron, in the very presence of the Lord God. Then they publicly anointed David as king over all Israel.

verses.latin: Triginta annorum erat David cum regnare cœpisset, et quadraginta annis regnavit.
verses.english: David was thirty years old when he began his reign as king, and he reigned for a total of forty years.

verses.latin: In Hebron septem annis et sex mensibus regnavit super Judam: et in Ierusalem triginta tribus annis regnavit super omnem Israël et Iudam.
verses.english: In Hebron, he reigned over the tribe of Judah for seven years and six months. Afterwards, in Jerusalem, he reigned over all of both Israel and Judah for thirty-three years.
