verses.english: Now in the letter he wrote, he gave these instructions: 'Place Uriah in the front line, where the battle is fiercest. Then withdraw from him, so that he may be struck down and die.'

verses.latin: Igitur cum Joab obsideret urbem, posuit Uriam in loco ubi sciebat viros esse fortissimos.
verses.english: So when Joab was besieging the city, he placed Uriah in a spot where he knew there were the strongest, most valiant enemy soldiers.

verses.latin: Egressique viri de civitate, pugnaverunt adversum Joab, et ceciderunt de populo servis David, et mortuus est etiam Urias Hethæus.
verses.english: And the men came out from the city and fought against Joab. Some of the soldiers, servants of King David, fell in battle, and Uriah the Hittite also died.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Joab, et nuntiavit David omnia verba prælii:
verses.english: Then Joab sent and reported to King David all the details of the battle.

verses.latin: et præcepit nuntio, dicens: Cum compleveris universos sermones belli ad regem,
verses.english: And he commanded the messenger, saying: 'When you have finished reporting all the words of the battle to the king—'

verses.latin: si forte iratus fuerit rex, et dixerit: Quare accessistis ad murum ut pugnaretis? an ignorabatis quod desuper ex muro jacitur quidquid huc opertum fuerit?
verses.english: '—if perhaps the king should become angry and say: Why did you approach the wall to fight? Did you not know that whatever is thrown from the wall above can easily kill? For example—'

verses.latin: quis percussit Abimelech filium Jerobaal? nonne mulier misit super eum fragmen molæ de muro, et interfecit eum in Thebes? quare juxta murum accessistis? Dices: Etiam servus tuus Urias Hethæus mortuus est.
verses.english: '—who killed Abimelech, the son of Jerubaal? Was it not a woman who threw a piece of a millstone upon him from the wall, and killed him in Thebez? Why did you approach so close to the wall? If he asks this, then you are to say: 'Indeed, your servant Uriah the Hittite is also dead.''

verses.latin: Abiit ergo nuntius, et venit ad David, et nuntiavit ei omnia quæ præceperat ei Joab.
verses.english: So the messenger went, and came to King David, and reported to him all that Joab had commanded him.

verses.latin: Et dixit nuntius ad David: Prævaluerunt adversum nos viri, et egressi sunt ad nos in campum: et fuimus inter eos usque ad portam civitatis.
verses.english: And the messenger said to King David: 'The men of the city overpowered us, and came out against us into the open field. And we fought them all the way to the gate of the city.'

verses.latin: Et jacuerunt jaculatores super servos tuos de muro, et mortui sunt de servis regis, quin potius et servus tuus Urias Hethæus mortuus est.
verses.english: 'And archers shot arrows upon your servants from the wall, and some of the king's servants died, and indeed, your servant Uriah the Hittite is also dead.'

verses.latin: Et ait David ad nuntium: Hæc dices Joab: Non te frangat ista res: varius enim eventus est belli, et nunc hunc, et nunc illum consumit gladius: instiga adversus urbem pugnam, et subverte eam: et confirma eum.
verses.english: And King David said to the messenger: 'Thus you shall say to Joab: 'Do not let this matter discourage you. For the outcome of war is uncertain; sometimes the sword consumes one man, and sometimes another. Intensify the fight against the city, and overthrow it.' And with these words, David sought to encourage Joab.

verses.latin: Audivit autem uxor Uriæ, quod mortuus esset Urias vir suus, et planxit virum suum.
verses.english: Now when Uriah's wife heard that Uriah, her husband, was dead, she mourned for her husband.

verses.latin: Transactoque luctu, misit David, et adduxit eam in domum suam, et facta est ei uxor, et peperit ei filium: et displicuit Sermo quem fecerat David coram Domino.
verses.english: And when her period of mourning was over, King David sent for her and brought her to his house, and she became his wife. Then she bore him a son. But the deed that King David had done was displeasing in the sight of the Lord.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Dominus Nathan ad David. Qui cum venisset ad eum, ait illi: Duo viri erant in civitate una, unus dives, et alter pauper.
verses.english: The Lord then sent the prophet Nathan to King David. When Nathan came to David, he told him a story: 'There were two men in one city; one was very rich, and the other was very poor.'

verses.latin: Dives habebat oves et boves plurimos valde.
verses.english: The rich man owned many, many sheep and cattle.

verses.latin: Pauper autem nihil habebat, absque una agna parvula, quam emerat et nutrierat, et quae creverat apud eum cum filiis ejus simul, de pane illius comedens, et de calice ejus bibens, et in sinu illius dormiens: eratque illi quasi filia.
verses.english: But the poor man had nothing at all, except one tiny lamb. He had bought it and raised it, and it grew up with him and his children. It would eat from his own plate, drink from his own cup, and sleep in his arms; it was like a daughter to him.

verses.latin: Cum autem venisset quidam viator ad divitem, parcens ille sumere de ovibus et de bobus suis, ut exhiberet convivium viatori suo, quem sibi hospitem receperat, tulit ovem viri pauperis, et præparavit viro qui venerat ad se.
verses.english: When a traveler came to the rich man, he refused to take from his own many sheep and cattle to prepare a meal for his guest, whom he had received as a visitor. Instead, he took the lamb of the poor man and prepared it for the person who had come to him.

verses.latin: Iratusque indignans David adversum virum, dixit ad Nathan: Vivit Dominus, quoniam filius mortis est vir qui hoc fecit.
verses.english: David became very angry and indignant at the man, and he said to Nathan, 'As the Lord lives, the man who did this deserves to die! His action is a capital offense.'

verses.latin: Agnam reddet quadruplum, eo quod fecerit verbum istud, et non pepercerit.
verses.english: 'He must repay the lamb fourfold because he did such a thing and showed no mercy.'

verses.latin: Dixit autem Nathan ad David: Tu es ille vir. Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israël: Ego unxi te regem super Israël, et ego erui te de manu Saul,
verses.english: Then Nathan said to David, 'You are that man! This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: 'I anointed you king over Israel, and I rescued you from the hand of Saul.'

verses.latin: et dedi tibi domum domini tui, et uxores domini tui in sinu tuo: dedique tibi domum Israël et Juda: et si parva sunt ista, adjiciam tibi multo majora.
verses.english: 'I gave you your master's house and your master's wives into your possession. I also gave you the kingdom of Israel and Judah. If all this were too little, I would have added even more to you.'

verses.latin: Quare ergo sprevisti verbum Domini, ut faceres malum in conspectu meo? Uriam Hethæum percussisti gladio, et uxorem ejus accepisti uxorem tibi, et interfecisti eum gladio filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: 'Why then have you despised the word of the Lord by doing evil in My sight? You struck down Uriah the Hittite with a sword, and you took his wife to be your own wife, and you killed him by the sword of the Ammonites.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo non recedet gladius de domo tua usque in sempiternum, eo quod sprevisti me, et sumpsisti uxorem Uriæ Hethæi, ut esset uxor tua.
verses.english: 'Therefore, the sword will never depart from your house from this day forward, because you have despised Me and have taken the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be your own wife.'

verses.latin: Hæc dicit Dominus: Ecce ego suscitabo super te malum de domo tua: et auferam uxores tuas in oculis tuis, et dabo proximo tuo, et dormiet cum uxoribus tuis in oculis solis hujus.
verses.english: 'This is what the Lord says: 'Behold, I will bring disaster upon you from your own household. I will take your wives and give them to your neighbor before your very eyes, and he will sleep with your wives in the sight of the sun itself, openly and without shame.''

verses.latin: Quoniam tu quidem fecisti abscondite: ego vero verbum istud faciam in conspectu omnis Israël, et in conspectu solis.
verses.english: 'For you acted in secret, but I will do this thing in the sight of all Israel and in the sight of the sun, making your sin publicly known.'

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Nathan: Peccavi Domino. Dixitque Nathan ad David: Dominus quoque transtulit peccatum tuum: non morieris.
verses.english: And David said to Nathan, 'I have sinned against the Lord.' Nathan then said to David, 'The Lord has also removed your sin; you will not die immediately for it.'

verses.latin: Verumtamen quoniam blasphemia nominis Domini dedisti inimicis, propter verbum hoc, filius qui natus fuerit tibi, morte morietur.
verses.english: 'Nevertheless, because by this deed you have given the enemies of the Lord great occasion to blaspheme His name, the child who is born to you will surely die.'

verses.latin: Et reversus est Nathan in domum suam. Percussit ergo Dominus parvulum, quem pepererat uxor Uriæ David: et ægrotavit.
verses.english: Then Nathan returned to his own house. And the Lord struck the child whom Uriah's wife had borne to David, and the child became very ill.

verses.latin: Deprecatusque est David Dominum pro parvulo: et jejunavit David jejunio, et ingressus seorsum jacuit super terram.
verses.english: David pleaded with the Lord for the child. David fasted by going without food, and he went into his private chamber and lay on the ground all night.

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo seniores domus ejus, ut sublevarent eum de terra: qui noluit, nec comedit cum eis panem.
verses.english: So the elders of his household came to him to raise him from the ground, but he refused their help and would not eat any food with them.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in die septima, mortuus est infans. Timueruntque servi David nuntiare ei quod mortuus esset parvulus. Dixerunt enim: Ecce cum adhuc viveret infans, loquebamur ad eum, et non audiebat voces nostras: quanto magis si dixerimus: Mortuus est puer, affliget se?
verses.english: On the seventh day, the child died. And David's servants were afraid to tell him that the child was dead, for they said, 'Look, while the child was still alive, we spoke to him, and he would not listen to our words. How much more will he afflict himself if we tell him that the boy is dead?'

verses.latin: Animadvertens autem David servos suos mussitantes, intellexit quod mortuus esset parvulus: interrogavitque servos suos, dicens: Num mortuus est infans? Qui responderunt ei: Mortuus est.
verses.english: But when David noticed his servants whispering among themselves, he understood that the child was dead. So he asked his servants, saying, 'Is the child dead?' And they answered him, 'He is dead.'

verses.latin: Surrexit ergo David de terra, et lavit, et unxit se, et mutavit vestimentum, et ingressus domum Domini, adoravit, et venit in domum suam, et postulavit sibi panem, et comedit.
verses.english: Then David arose from the ground, washed himself, anointed himself with oil, and changed his clothing. He went into the house of the Lord and worshiped there. Then he returned to his own house and requested food, and he ate.

verses.latin: Dixerunt autem ei servi sui: Quid est hoc verbum, quod fecisti? Propter infantem adhuc viventem jejunasti et flebas: mortuo autem puero, surrexisti, et comedisti panem.
verses.english: His servants then said to him, 'What is this thing you have done? While the child was still alive, you fasted and wept. But now that the child is dead, you have risen and eaten bread.'

verses.latin: Qui ait: Propter infantem adhuc viventem jejunavi et flevi, quia dicebam: Quis scit si forte misereatur mei Dominus, et vivat infans?
verses.english: He replied, 'While the child was still alive, I fasted and wept, because I thought to myself: 'Who knows? Perhaps the Lord will have mercy on me, and the child will live.''

verses.latin: Nunc autem mortuus est: quare jejunarem? Numquid potero eum ultra adducere? Ego vadam ad eum, ille vero non revertetur ad me.
verses.english: 'But now that the child is dead, why should I continue to fast? Can I bring him back again? I will go to him in death, but he will not return to me in life.'

verses.latin: Et consolatus est David Bathsabee uxorem suam: ingressusque ad eam, dormivit cum illa: et concepit, et peperit filium, et vocavit nomen ejus Salomon: et Dominus dilexit eum.
verses.english: And David comforted Bathsheba, his wife. He went in to her and slept with her. She conceived and gave birth to a son, and he named him Solomon. And the Lord loved this child.

verses.latin: Et misit in manu Nathan prophetæ, et vocavit nomen ejus Amabile Domino, eo quod Dominus diligeret eum.
verses.english: And the Lord sent a message by the hand of Nathan the prophet, and he called the child's name Jedidiah (which means 'Beloved of the Lord'), because the Lord loved him.

verses.latin: Igitur Joab expugnabat Rabbath filiorum Ammon, et apprehendit urbem regiam.
verses.english: Now Joab was fighting against Rabbah of the Ammonites, and he captured the royal city, which was the capital.

verses.latin: Misitque nuntios ad David, dicens: Expugnavi Rabbath, et comprehendi civitatem aquarum.
verses.english: And Joab sent messengers to David, saying, 'I have fought against Rabbah and have captured the city's water supply.'

verses.latin: Nunc igitur congrega reliquam partem populi, et obside civitatem, et cape eam: ne cum a me capta fuerit civitas, meum ponatur nomen.
verses.english: 'Now, therefore, gather the rest of the people and besiege the city yourself, and capture it. Do this so that when the city is taken, it will not be named after me, but after you.'

verses.latin: Congregavit itaque David omnem populum, et profectus est contra Rabbath: cumque oppugnasset eam, cepit.
verses.english: So David gathered all the people and went against Rabbah. He fought against it and captured it.

verses.latin: Et tulit diadema regis eorum de capite ejus, pondus aureum talentum, habensque in ipso pretiosissimas gemmas: et positum est super caput David: sed et de præda civitatis asportavit multam nimis.
verses.english: And David took the crown of their king from his head. Its weight was a talent of gold, and it had precious stones embedded in it. It was then placed upon David's own head. He also carried away a very great amount of plunder from the city.

verses.latin: Populum quoque ejus adduxit, et serravit in serris, et in traturis ferreis, et in securibus ferreis transire fecit, ita ut ignis camini et fornacis transirent illos: sic fecit universis urbibus filiorum Ammon. Et reversus est David, et omnis exercitus ejus in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He also brought out the people who were in it and put them to forced labor with saws, with iron picks, and with iron axes. He made them pass through the brick kiln, meaning he subjected them to harsh, enslaving labor, including making bricks. He did this to all the cities of the Ammonites. Then David and all his army returned to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post hæc: Absalom filii David soror pulcherrima, nomine Thamar; et dilexit eam Amnon filius David.
verses.english: After these events, Absalom, a son of King David, had a very beautiful sister named Tamar. Amnon, another son of King David, then fell deeply in love with her.

verses.latin: Et anxiatus est Amnon usque ad languorem propter Thamar sororem suam, quia virgo erat: et difficile ei videbatur ut quidquam faceret.
verses.english: Amnon became so distressed over his sister Tamar that he fell sick and grew weak. This was because she was a virgin, and it seemed impossible for him to act on his sinful desire for her.

verses.latin: Habebat autem Amnon amicum, nomine Jonadab, filium Sammaa fratris David: vir autem Jonadab erat prudentissimus nimis.
verses.english: Now, Amnon had a friend named Jonadab. Jonadab was the son of Shimeah, who was King David's brother—making him Amnon's cousin. Jonadab was an extremely shrewd and cunning man.

verses.latin: Et dixit ei: Quare sic attenuaris, fili regis, per singulos dies? nonne indicas mihi? Dixitque ei Amnon: Thamar sororem Absalom fratris mei amo.
verses.english: Jonadab asked Amnon, 'Why do you look so worn out and thin, O son of the king, day after day? Won't you tell me what's bothering you?' Amnon answered him, 'I am in love with Tamar, the beautiful sister of my brother Absalom.'

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Jonadab: Cubato super lectum tuum, et simula ægrotum: cumque venerit pater tuus ut visitet te, dices ei: Veniat obsecro Thamar soror mea, ut det mihi cibum, et faciat pulmentum, ut comedam de manu ejus.
verses.english: Then Jonadab said to him, 'Lie down on your bed and pretend to be sick. When your father, King David, comes to visit you, you must say to him: 'Please, let my sister Tamar come and prepare some food for me. Let her make me a special dish so I can eat it from her hand.''

verses.latin: Dormivit itaque Amnon, et simulavit ægrotum: venitque rex ad visitandum eum: et ait Amnon ad regem: Veniat, obsecro, Thamar soror mea, ut faciat in oculis meis duas sorbitiunculas, et cibum capiam de manu ejus.
verses.english: So Amnon lay down and pretended to be sick. King David came to visit him. Amnon then said to the king, 'Please, let my sister Tamar come and make two little cakes right before my eyes, so I may eat from her hand.'

verses.latin: Misit ergo David ad Thamar, domum dicens: Veni ad domum Amnon fratris tui, et fac illi cibum.
verses.english: So King David sent word to Tamar at her home, saying, 'Please go to the house of your brother Amnon and prepare some food for him.'

verses.latin: Venitque Thamar in domum Amnon fratris sui: ipse autem jacebat. Quæ sumens farinam, et commiscens, liquefecit in oculis ejus, et coxit sorbitiunculas.
verses.english: Tamar went to the house of her brother Amnon, who was lying down. She took flour, mixed it, and prepared it right before his eyes. Then she cooked the little cakes.

verses.latin: Et assumens quod coxerat, posuit coram eo: et noluit comedere. Dixitque Amnon: Ejicite universos a me. Cumque ejecissent omnes, et exissent foras:
verses.english: She took what she had cooked and set it before him, but he refused to eat. Amnon then said, 'Send everyone out from me.' So everyone was put out and left the room.

verses.latin: Dixit Amnon ad Thamar: Infer cibum in conclave, ut comedam de manu tua. Tulitque Thamar sorbitiunculas quas fecerat, et intulit ad Amnon fratrem suum in conclave.
verses.english: Amnon said to Tamar, 'Bring the food into the inner room so I can eat it from your hand.' Tamar then took the little cakes she had made and brought them to her brother Amnon in the inner room.

verses.latin: Cumque obtulisset ei ut comederet, apprehendit eam, et ait: Veni, cubemus mecum, soror mea.
verses.english: When she offered the food to him so he might eat, he seized her and said, 'Come, my sister, lie with me.'

verses.latin: Quæ respondit ei: Noli, frater mi, noli opprimere me: neque enim hoc fieri licet in Israël. Noli hanc rem facere stultam.
verses.english: She answered him, 'No, my brother, do not violate me! For such a thing is not allowed in Israel. Do not commit this utterly foolish and wicked act.'

verses.latin: Quo enim ibo, dedecus meum? et tu eris quasi unus de insipientibus in Israël. Quin potius loquere ad regem, et non negabit tibi me.
verses.english: For where would I go with my disgrace? And you would be considered like one of the most foolish and wicked men in Israel. Instead, why not speak to the king? He would not deny me to you in marriage, if you asked properly.'

verses.latin: Et noluit acquiescere precibus ejus, sed prævaluit, et humiliavit eam, et concubuit cum ea.
verses.english: But he refused to listen to her pleas. Instead, he overpowered her, disgraced her, and lay with her through force.

verses.latin: Et odio habuit Amnon Thamar magno odio nimis, ita ut majus esset odium quo oderat eam, quam amor quo dilexerat. Et ait illi Amnon: Surge, et vade.
verses.english: Then Amnon hated Tamar with an exceedingly great hatred. His hatred for her was greater than the love he had felt for her. And Amnon said to her, 'Get up and leave!'

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Thamar: Neque hoc est majus malum, quod prius fecisti in me, ut ejicias me foras. Et noluit audire eam.
verses.english: Tamar said to him, 'No! This additional evil of casting me out now is even greater than the evil you have already done to me!' But Amnon refused to listen to her.

verses.latin: Vocavitque puerum qui ministrabat ei, et ait: Ejice hanc a me foras, et claude ostium post eam.
verses.english: He called the young man who served him and said, 'Throw this woman out from me and lock the door behind her.'

verses.latin: Porro illa induta erat tunica polymita: tali enim veste uti filiæ regis virgines solebant. Ejecit itaque eam minister ejus foras, et clausit ostium post eam.
verses.english: Now, Tamar was wearing a long, full-sleeved tunic, which was the customary garment for royal virgins. So Amnon's servant put her out and locked the door behind her.

verses.latin: Aspergens autem pulvere caput suum, scissa tunica polymita, quam habebat, posuit manum super caput suum, et abiit, clamans.
verses.english: But Tamar, scattering ashes on her head and tearing the long, full-sleeved tunic she wore, put her hand upon her head and went away, crying out in great distress.

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Absalom frater ejus: Numquid non Amnon frater tuus fuit tecum? nunc ergo tace, soror mea, frater tuus est, et ne contristes cor tuum pro hac re. Mansit itaque Thamar desolata in domo Absalom fratris sui.
verses.english: Her brother Absalom said to her, 'Was it not your brother Amnon who was with you? Now, then, be silent, my sister. He is your brother. Do not let this matter grieve your heart so much.' So Tamar remained desolate and disgraced in the house of her brother Absalom.

verses.latin: Audivit autem rex David omnia hæc verba, et iratus est nimis.
verses.english: Now, King David heard about all these things and became exceedingly angry.

verses.latin: Sed non est locutus Absalom ad Amnon, nec malum nec bonum: oderat enim Absalom Amnon, eo quod violasset Thamar sororem suam.
verses.english: However, Absalom did not speak to Amnon, neither for good nor for evil—he did not confront him. For Absalom hated Amnon because he had violated his sister Tamar.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post spatium duorum annorum, ut tonderentur oves Absalom in Baalhasor, quæ est juxta Ephraim: et vocavit Absalom omnes filios regis.
verses.english: It happened after a period of two years that Absalom's sheep were being sheared in Baal Hazor, which is near Ephraim. Absalom then invited all the king's sons to a feast.

verses.latin: Et venit ad regem Absalom, et ait ad eum: Ecce tondentur oves servi tui: veniat, oro, rex cum servis suis ad servum tuum.
verses.english: Absalom came to the king and said to him, 'Behold, your servant's sheep are being sheared. Please, let the king and his servants come to your servant's feast.'

verses.latin: Dixitque rex ad Absalom: Noli, fili mi, obsecro, ne omnes veniamus, et gravemus te. Et cum coegisset eum, noluit ire, et benedixit ei.
verses.english: But the king said to Absalom, 'No, my son, please, let us not all come, lest we be a burden to you.' Though Absalom urged him, King David refused to go, but he gave Absalom his blessing.

verses.latin: Et ait Absalom: Si non vis venire, obsecro, ut veniat saltem Amnon frater meus nobiscum. Dixitque ei rex: Quare vadit tecum?
verses.english: Then Absalom said, 'If you will not come, please let my brother Amnon at least come with us.' The king asked him, 'Why should he go with you?'

verses.latin: Coegit ergo Absalom regem, et dimisit cum eo Amnon, et universos filios regis.
verses.english: But Absalom pressed the king with his request, so David sent Amnon and all the rest of the king's sons with him.

verses.latin: Præceperat autem Absalom pueris suis, dicens: Adtendite cum hilaritate oppressus fuerit Amnon vino, et dixero vobis: Percutite Amnon, et interficite, nolite timere: nonne ego sum qui præcepi vobis? Confortamini, et estote viri fortes.
verses.english: Now Absalom had given orders to his young men, saying, 'Watch closely when Amnon's heart is cheerful with wine, and when I say to you, 'Strike Amnon and kill him!' Do not be afraid! Have I not commanded you? Be strong and show yourselves to be brave men!'

verses.latin: Fecerunt ergo pueri Absalom Amnon, sicut præceperat eis Absalom. Surrexerunt autem omnes filii regis, et ascenderunt unusquisque mulum suum, et fugerunt.
verses.english: So Absalom's young men did to Amnon just as Absalom had commanded them. Then all the other sons of the king rose up, each mounted his mule, and they fled.

verses.latin: Cumque adhuc essent in via, rumor venit ad David, dicens: Percussit Absalom omnes filios regis, et non remansit ex eis nec unus.
verses.english: While they were still on the way, a rumor reached King David, saying, 'Absalom has killed all the king's sons, and not even one of them remains alive!'

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque rex, et scidit vestimenta sua, et corruit super terram: et omnes servi ejus, qui assistebant ei, sciderunt vestimenta sua.
verses.english: Then the king arose, tore his royal garments, and fell to the ground. All his servants who stood by him also tore their own garments in sorrow.

verses.latin: Conflixit autem Jonadab filius Sammaa fratris David, et ait: Ne existimet dominus meus rex quod omnes pueri filii regis occisi sint: solus Amnon mortuus est, quoniam in ore Absalom erat positum ex die qua oppressit Thamar sororem suam.
verses.english: But Jonadab, the son of Shimeah, David's brother, spoke up and said, 'Let not my lord the king think that all the young men, the king's sons, have been killed. Only Amnon is dead. For this was planned by Absalom from the day that Amnon violated his sister Tamar.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo non adponat dominus meus rex super cor suum, dicens: Omnes filii regis mortui sunt: quoniam solus Amnon mortuus est.
verses.english: 'Therefore, now let not my lord the king take it to heart, thinking: 'All the king's sons are dead.' For only Amnon is dead.'

verses.latin: Fugit autem Absalom. Et levavit puer speculaturus oculos suos, et aspexit: et ecce populus multus de via ad latera montis per afractus viæ veniebant.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Absalom had fled. And the young watchman lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, a large company of people were coming by way of the road along the side of the mountain, through the winding paths.

verses.latin: Et ait Jonadab ad regem: Ecce filii regis veniunt: sicut locutus sum, ita factum est.
verses.english: Then Jonadab said to the king, 'Behold, the king's sons are coming! It has happened just as I said it would.'

verses.latin: Cumque cessasset loqui, apparuerunt et filii regis: levaveruntque vocem suam, et ploraverunt. Sed et rex, et omnes servi ejus flebant ploratu magno nimis.
verses.english: As soon as he finished speaking, the king's sons appeared. They raised their voices and wept loudly. And the king also, with all his servants, wept with an exceedingly great lamentation.

verses.latin: Absalom autem fugiens, abiit ad Tholomai filium Ammiud regem Gessur. Luxit ergo David filium suum cunctis diebus.
verses.english: But Absalom, having fled, went to Talmai, the son of Ammihud, the king of Geshur. So King David mourned for his son Amnon for many days.

verses.latin: Cumque fugisset Absalom, et venisset in Gessur, fuit ibi tribus annis.
verses.english: When Absalom had fled and arrived in Geshur, he remained there for three years.

verses.latin: Cessavitque David rex persequens Absalom, consolatus est enim super Amnon quod mortuus esset.
verses.english: And King David ceased pursuing Absalom, for he had been comforted over Amnon, seeing that he was dead.

verses.latin: No verse 40 in Clementine Vulgate 2 Samuel 13. The chapter ends at verse 39.
verses.english: This verse does not exist in the Clementine Vulgate for 2 Samuel Chapter 13.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post haec, ut Absalom filius David pulcherrimam sororem haberet, nomine Thamar: acciditque ut amaret eam Amnon filius David.
verses.english: Now after these events, Absalom, a son of King David, had a very beautiful sister named Tamar. And Amnon, another son of David, fell in love with her.

verses.latin: Et vexatus est Amnon usque ad marorem, ita ut tabesceret propter Thamar sororem suam: quia virgo erat, et difficile videbatur in oculis Amnon ut quippiam de illa faceret.
verses.english: Amnon was so distressed over her that he became sick, wasting away because of Tamar, his sister. For she was a virgin, and it seemed impossible in Amnon's eyes to do anything with her.

verses.latin: Habebat autem Amnon amicum, nomine Jonadab, filium Semmaa fratris David, virum valde callidum:
verses.english: But Amnon had a friend named Jonadab, the son of Shimeah (David's brother). Jonadab was a very cunning man.

verses.latin: qui dixit ei: Quare sic attenuaris, fili regis, per singulos dies? cur non indicas mihi? Dixitque ei Amnon: Thamar sororem Absalom fratris mei amo.
verses.english: Jonadab said to Amnon, 'Why are you so wasted away, son of the king, day after day? Why don't you tell me?' Amnon replied to him, 'I love Tamar, the sister of my brother Absalom.'

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Jonadab: Cubato super lectum tuum, et simula te ægrotum. Cumque venerit pater tuus, ut visitet te, dices ei: Veniat, obsecro, Thamar soror mea, ut det mihi cibum, et faciat pulmentum, ut reficiar, et bibam de manu ejus.
verses.english: Jonadab then said to him, 'Lie down on your bed and pretend to be sick. When your father comes to visit you, you must say to him: 'Please let my sister Tamar come and give me food. Let her prepare some warm food in my presence, so I can see it and eat from her hand.'

verses.latin: Accubuit ergo Amnon, et simulavit ægrotum: venitque rex ad visitandum eum. Et ait Amnon ad regem: Veniat, obsecro, Thamar soror mea, ut faciat in oculis meis duas sorbitiunculas, et cibum capiam de manu ejus.
verses.english: So Amnon lay down and pretended to be sick. The king came to visit him. Amnon then said to the king, 'Please let my sister Tamar come and make two small portions of food in my presence, so I may eat from her hand.'

verses.latin: Misit ergo David ad Thamar domum, dicens: Veni in domum Amnon fratris tui, et fac illi cibum.
verses.english: So King David sent word to Tamar at her home, saying, 'Go to your brother Amnon's house and prepare food for him.'

verses.latin: Venitque Thamar in domum Amnon fratris sui: ipse autem jacebat. Quæ tulit farinam, et commiscuit: et conspergans in oculis ejus, coxit sorbitiunculas.
verses.english: Tamar went to the house of her brother Amnon, who was lying down. She took flour, mixed it, and prepared the small portions of food in his sight, cooking them.

verses.latin: Et sumens quod coxerat, effudit: et posuit coram eo, et noluit comedere. Dixitque Amnon: Ejicite universos a me. Cumque ejecissent omnes, et exiissent:
verses.english: Then she took what she had cooked and served it to him. But he refused to eat. Amnon said, 'Send everyone away from me!' So all the servants were sent out and left the room.

verses.latin: Dixit Amnon ad Thamar: Infer cibum in conclave, ut comedam de manu tua. Tulitque Thamar sorbitiunculas quas fecerat, et intulit ad Amnon fratrem suum in conclave.
verses.english: Amnon then said to Tamar, 'Bring the food into the inner room, so I may eat from your hand.' Tamar took the portions she had made and brought them to her brother Amnon in the inner room.

verses.latin: Cumque obtulisset ei, apprehendit illam: et ait: Veni, cubemus, soror mea.
verses.english: As she offered it to him, he seized her and said, 'Come, lie down with me, my sister.'

verses.latin: Quæ respondit ei: Noli, frater mi, noli opprimere me: neque enim hoc fieri licet in Israël: noli facere stultitiam hanc.
verses.english: She answered him, 'No, my brother, do not do violence to me! For such a thing is not permitted in Israel; do not commit this foolish act.'

verses.latin: Et ego quo ibo, ut celarem turpitudinem meam? et tu eris quasi unus de insipientibus in Israël. Quin potius loquere ad regem, et non negabit tibi me.
verses.english: 'And where would I go to hide my disgrace? And you, my brother, would become like one of the foolish men in Israel. Why not speak to the king instead? He would not refuse to give me to you in marriage.'

verses.latin: Noluit autem acquiescere precibus ejus: sed prævalens, oppressit eam, et concubuit cum ea.
verses.english: But he refused to listen to her pleas. Instead, overpowering her, he did violence to her and lay with her.

verses.latin: Et odivit Amnon Thamar odio magno nimis, ita ut majus esset odium quo oderat eam, quam amor quo amabat ante. Et dixit ei Amnon: Surge, et vade.
verses.english: Then Amnon hated Tamar with an exceedingly great hatred, so much that the hatred with which he hated her was greater than the love with which he had loved her before. And Amnon said to her, 'Get up and go away!'

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Thamar: Neque hoc est majus malum, quod prius fecisti in me, ut ejicias me. Et noluit audire eam.
verses.english: Tamar said to him, 'No, this evil of sending me away is greater than the other evil you have already done to me.' But he would not listen to her.

verses.latin: Vocavitque puerum suum, qui ministrabat ei, et ait: Ejice hanc a me foras, et claude ostium post eam.
verses.english: He called his servant who attended him and said, 'Throw this woman out from my presence and bolt the door behind her!'

verses.latin: Habebat autem illa tunicam talarem, et manicatam: hujuscemodi vestibus induebantur filiæ regum virgines. Ejecit itaque eam minister ejus foras: et clausit ostium post eam.
verses.english: Now she was wearing a long, sleeved tunic. For such garments were worn by the virgin daughters of kings. So his servant threw her out and bolted the door behind her.

verses.latin: Sparsito pulverem super caput suum, et scissa veste talari, et posita manu super caput, ibat ingrediens, et clamans.
verses.english: Tamar then sprinkled dust on her head, tore her sleeved tunic, put her hand upon her head, and went away, walking and crying out in distress.

verses.latin: Dixitque ei Absalom frater ejus: Numquid non Amnon frater tuus fuit tecum? sed nunc, soror, tace, quia frater tuus est: et ne contristes cor tuum pro hac re. Mansit itaque Thamar desolata in domo Absalom fratris sui.
verses.english: Her brother Absalom said to her, 'Was your brother Amnon with you? But now, sister, be silent, for he is your brother. Do not let this matter grieve your heart.' So Tamar remained desolate in her brother Absalom's house.

verses.latin: Audivit autem rex David universa verba hæc: et contristatus est valde.
verses.english: Now King David heard about all these things and was greatly distressed.

verses.latin: Porro Absalom nec locutus est ad Amnon, nec malum nec bonum: oderat enim Absalom Amnon, eo quod violasset Thamar sororem suam.
verses.english: However, Absalom did not speak to Amnon, neither good nor evil. For Absalom hated Amnon because he had violated his sister Tamar.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post spatium duorum annorum, ut tonderentur oves Absalom in Baalhasor, quæ est juxta Ephraim: et vocavit Absalom omnes filios regis.
verses.english: Now after two full years, Absalom's sheep were being sheared in Baal Hazor, which is near Ephraim. And Absalom invited all the king's sons.

verses.latin: Et venit Absalom ad regem, et ait illi: Ecce tondentur oves servi tui: veniat, obsecro, rex cum servis suis ad servum tuum.
verses.english: Absalom came to the king and said to him, 'Behold, your servant's sheep are being sheared. Please, let the king and his servants come with your servant.'

verses.latin: Dixitque rex ad Absalom: Noli, fili mi, obsecro, ne forte gravemus te. Cumque cogeret eum, et ille nollet ire, benedixit ei.
verses.english: But the king said to Absalom, 'No, my son, please, do not let us all go, lest we be a burden to you.' Though Absalom urged him, David would not go, but he blessed him instead.

verses.latin: Et ait Absalom: Si non vis venire, obsecro, ut saltem frater meus Amnon veniat nobiscum. Dixitque ei rex: Quare vadit tecum?
verses.english: Absalom said, 'If you will not come, please, let my brother Amnon at least come with us.' The king asked him, 'Why should he go with you?'

verses.latin: Cogente autem Absalom, dimisit cum eo Amnon et universos filios regis.
verses.english: But Absalom urged him so strongly that David sent Amnon and all the king's other sons with him.

verses.latin: Præceperat autem Absalom pueris suis, dicens: Observate cum hilaritate fuerit Amnon vino, et dixero vobis: Percutite Amnon, et interficite eum: nolite timere: nonne ego sum qui præcipio vobis? Confortamini, et estote viri fortes.
verses.english: Now Absalom had given orders to his young men, saying, 'Watch when Amnon's heart is cheerful from wine. And when I tell you: Strike Amnon and kill him, do not be afraid! Is it not I who command you? Be courageous and be strong men!'

verses.latin: Fecerunt itaque pueri Absalom Amnon quod præceperat Absalom. Commoti sunt autem omnes filii regis: et ascenderunt singuli mulos suos, fugeruntque.
verses.english: So Absalom's young men did to Amnon just as Absalom had commanded. Then all the king's other sons quickly rose, and each one mounted his mule and fled.

verses.latin: Cumque adhuc essent in via, rumor advenit ad David, dicens: Percussit Absalom omnes filios regis: et non remansit ex eis saltem unus.
verses.english: While they were still on the way, a rumor reached King David, saying, 'Absalom has struck down all the king's sons! Not even one of them remains!'

verses.latin: Surrexit itaque rex, et scidit vestimenta sua, et corruit super terram: et omnes servi ejus, qui assistebant ei, sciderunt vestimenta sua.
verses.english: So the king rose, tore his clothes, and fell to the ground. And all his servants who stood by him also tore their clothes.

verses.latin: Respondens autem Jonadab filius Semmaa fratris David, ait: Ne existimet dominus meus rex quod omnes pueri filii regis interfecti sint: solus Amnon mortuus est: quoniam in ore Absalom fuerat statutum ex die qua oppressit Thamar sororem suam.
verses.english: But Jonadab, the son of Shimeah (David's brother), answered and said, 'Let not my lord the king imagine that all the young men, the king's sons, have been killed. Only Amnon is dead. For this was determined by Absalom from the day that Amnon violated his sister Tamar.'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo ne ponat dominus meus rex super cor suum, dicens: Omnes filii regis mortui sunt: quoniam solus Amnon mortuus est.
verses.english: Therefore, let not my lord the king take it to heart now, thinking: 'All the king's sons are dead.' For only Amnon is dead.

verses.latin: Fugit autem Absalom. Et levavit puer speculator oculos suos, et aspexit: et ecce populus multus de via devexa montis, et latere veniebat.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Absalom had fled. And the young watchman lifted his eyes and looked, and behold, a large crowd of people were coming down the road on the side of the mountain.

verses.latin: Dixitque Jonadab ad regem: Ecce filii regis veniunt: juxta verbum servi tui, ita factum est.
verses.english: Jonadab then said to the king, 'Look! The king's sons are coming! What your servant said has happened.'

verses.latin: Cumque cessasset loqui, apparuerunt et filii regis: et elevantes vocem suam, planxerunt: sed et rex, et omnes servi ejus fleverunt ploratu magno nimis.
verses.english: As soon as he finished speaking, the king's sons appeared, and they raised their voices and wept. Even the king and all his servants wept with an exceedingly great lamentation.

verses.latin: Absalom autem fugiens, abiit ad Tholomai filium Ammiud regem Gessur. Luxit ergo David filium suum cunctis diebus.
verses.english: Absalom, however, fled and went to Talmai, the son of Ammihud, the king of Geshur. So David mourned for his son Amnon for many days.

verses.latin: Porro Absalom cum fugisset, et venisset in Gessur, fuit ibi tribus annis.
verses.english: Absalom, after he fled and arrived in Geshur, remained there for three years.

verses.latin: Desiitque rex David persequi Absalom, eo quod consolatus esset super Amnon interfecto.
verses.english: And King David ceased from pursuing Absalom, because he had become reconciled to Amnon's death.

verses.latin: Et mortuus est.
verses.english: And Amnon died.

verses.latin: Sciens ergo Joab filius Sarviae quod cor regis esset super Absalom,
verses.english: Therefore, Joab, the son of Zeruiah, knew that King David’s heart was longing for Absalom.

verses.latin: misit Thecuam, et tulit inde mulierem prudentem, et dixit ad eam: Finge te lugentem, et induere veste lugubri, et ne ungaris oleo, ut sis quasi mulier plurimo jam tempore lugens mortuum:
verses.english: So Joab sent to Tekoa and brought a wise woman from there. He said to her: 'Pretend to be in mourning, and put on the clothes of a mourner. Do not anoint yourself with oil, so that you look like a woman who has been mourning a dead person for a long time.'

verses.latin: et ingredere ad regem, et loquere ad eum sermones istos. Et posuit Joab verba in ore ejus.
verses.english: Then go to the king and speak these exact words to him.' And Joab carefully instructed her on everything she was to say.

verses.latin: Ingresso ergo mulier thecuitide ad regem, cecidit coram eo super terram, et adoravit, et dixit: Salva me rex.
verses.english: So the woman from Tekoa came to the king, fell before him to the ground, and bowed down, saying, 'Help me, King!'

verses.latin: Et ait ad eam rex: Quid tibi est? Quae respondit: Heu! mulier vidua ego sum: et mortuus est vir meus.
verses.english: The king asked her, 'What is troubling you?' She answered, 'Alas! I am a widow, and my husband is dead.'

verses.latin: Et ancillae tuae erant duo filii: qui litigaverunt adversum se in agro, nullusque erat qui eos interponeret: et percussit alter alterum, et interfecit eum.
verses.english: 'And your handmaid had two sons. They fought against each other in the field, and there was no one to intervene and separate them. One struck the other and killed him.'

verses.latin: Et ecce consurgens universa cognatio contra ancillam tuam, dicunt: Trade eum qui percussit fratrem suum, ut occidamus eum pro anima fratris sui, quem interfecit, et deleamus haeredem: et sic quaerunt extinguere scintillam meam relictam, ut non sit viro meo nomen, et reliquiae super terram.
verses.english: 'And behold, the whole family has risen up against your handmaid, saying: "Hand over the one who struck his brother, so we may put him to death for the life of his brother whom he killed, and so destroy the heir!" They are seeking to extinguish the only remaining spark of my family, so that my husband will have no name or descendants left on the earth.'

verses.latin: Et ait rex ad mulierem: Vade in domum tuam, et ego de te praecipiam.
verses.english: The king said to the woman, 'Go to your house, and I will give orders concerning you.'

verses.latin: Et dixit mulier Thecuitis ad regem: In me sit, domine mi rex, iniquitas, et in domum patris mei: tu autem rex, et solium tuum, immaculatum sit.
verses.english: The woman from Tekoa said to the king, 'My lord king, let the guilt be on me and on my father’s house; but may you, O king, and your throne, be free from all blame.'

verses.latin: Et ait rex: Qui contradixerit tibi, adduc illum ad me, et ultra non addet ut tangat te.
verses.english: The king said, 'Whoever speaks against you, bring him to me, and he will not bother you again.'

verses.latin: Et ille ait: Recordetur, obsecro, rex Domini Dei tui, ut non multiplicetur proximus sanguinis ad occidendum, et ne deleant filium meum. Qui ait: Vivit Dominus, si ceciderit de capillis filii tui in terram.
verses.english: She said, 'I beg you, King, remember the Lord your God, so that the avenger of blood may not multiply the killing, and not destroy my son.' The king responded, 'As the Lord lives, not one hair of your son shall fall to the ground!'

verses.latin: Et ait mulier: Loquatur ancilla tua, ad dominum meum regem, verbum. Et ait: Loquere.
verses.english: Then the woman said, 'May your handmaid speak a word to my lord the king.' He said, 'Speak.'

verses.latin: Et ait mulier: Quare ergo cogitasti hujuscemodi rem contra populum Dei? Et de rege, quasi de peccatore, loquitur, qui non reducit ejectum suum.
verses.english: The woman then said, 'Why then have you thought of such a thing against the people of God? For in speaking this, the king implicates himself as a sinner, since he does not bring back his own banished son.'

verses.latin: Omnes morimur, et quasi aquae dilabimur in terram, quae non revertuntur: nec vult Deus perire animam, sed retractat cogitans ne pariter pereat qui abjectus est.
verses.english: 'We all must die, and we are like water poured out on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again. Yet God does not desire for a soul to perish, but rather thinks of ways that the banished one may not be utterly cut off.'

verses.latin: Nunc igitur veni ut loquar ad regem dominum meum verbum hoc, prae timore populi: et dixit ancilla tua: Loquar ad regem, si forte faciat rex verbum ancillae suae.
verses.english: 'Now, therefore, I have come to speak this word to my lord the king, out of fear of the people. And your handmaid thought: "I will speak to the king, perhaps the king will grant his handmaid’s request."'

verses.latin: Et audivit rex ut liberaret ancillam suam de manu viri exeuntis, ut tolleret me et filium meum simul de haereditate Dei.
verses.english: 'For the king heard me, and will deliver his handmaid from the power of the man who seeks to banish me, and to completely cut off me and my son from God’s inheritance.'

verses.latin: Dixitque ancilla tua: Sit verbum domini mei regis, quasi angelus Dei, sic enim est dominus meus rex, ut non sentiatur benedictio et maledictio: et Dominus Deus tuus sit tecum.
verses.english: 'Your handmaid said: "May the word of my lord the king be like the angel of God, for my lord the king is truly discerning, able to distinguish between good and evil. And may the Lord your God be with you."'

verses.latin: Et respondens rex, ait ad mulierem: Ne abscondas a me verbum quod te interrogo. Et ait mulier: Loquatur dominus meus rex.
verses.english: The king answered and said to the woman, 'Do not hide from me the word that I am about to ask you.' The woman said, 'Let my lord the king speak.'

verses.latin: Et ait rex: Numquid non manus Joab tecum est in omnibus istis? Respondit mulier, et ait: Per salutem animae tuae, domine mi rex, nec ad dextram, nec ad sinistram potest deviari ab omnibus his quae locutus est dominus meus rex: tu enim es sapientia, quasi angelus Dei, ut intelligas omnia in terra.
verses.english: The king said, 'Is not the hand of Joab with you in all this?' The woman answered and said, 'As your soul lives, my lord king, it is impossible to deviate to the right or to the left from anything my lord the king has said. For you are wise, like an angel of God, to understand all things on the earth.'

verses.latin: Igitur hac de causa, fecit servus tuus Joab verbum istud: ut mutarem speciem sermonis: tu autem, domine mi, sapiens es, sicut sapientia angeli Dei, ut scias omnia quae fiunt super terram.
verses.english: 'Therefore, for this very reason, your servant Joab did this thing: to change the appearance of my speech and plead the case. But you, my lord, are as wise as the wisdom of an angel of God, so you understand all things that happen on earth.'

verses.latin: Et ait rex ad Joab: Ecce placatus feci verbum tuum: et vade, reduc puerum Absalom.
verses.english: The king then said to Joab, 'Behold, I have granted your request. Go and bring back the young man Absalom.'

verses.latin: Cadensque Joab super terram in faciem suam, adoravit, et benedixit regi: et ait Joab: Benedicta sit anima servi tui hodie, qui inveni gratiam coram te, domine mi rex, et fecisti verbum servi tui.
verses.english: Joab fell to the ground on his face, bowed down, and blessed the king. Joab said, 'Blessed be the soul of your servant today, because I have found favor in your sight, my lord king, and you have granted your servant’s request.'

verses.latin: Surrexit ergo Joab, et abiit in Gessur, et reduxit Absalom in Jerusalem.
verses.english: So Joab arose and went to Geshur, and brought Absalom back to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et ait rex: Revertatur in domum suam, et faciem meam non videat. Reversus est itaque Absalom in domum suam, et faciem regis non vidit.
verses.english: But the king said, 'Let him return to his own house, and not see my face.' So Absalom returned to his own house and did not see the king’s face.

verses.latin: Sicut autem Absalom, vir pulcherrimus fuit in omni Israel, et nimium decorus: a vestigio pedis, usque ad verticem, non erat in eo ulla macula.
verses.english: Now, Absalom was the most handsome man in all of Israel, and exceedingly beautiful. From the sole of his foot to the crown of his head, there was no blemish in him.

verses.latin: Et cum tonderet capillum semel in anno, quia gravabatur caesaries, subtendebatur, et appendebantur capilli capitis ejus duobus centum siclis, pondere publico.
verses.english: When he cut his hair once a year—because his hair would become very heavy, it would be shorn—the hair from his head weighed two hundred shekels by the royal standard.

verses.latin: Nati sunt autem Absalom filii tres, et filia una nomine Thamar, egregia forma.
verses.english: Three sons were born to Absalom, and one daughter whose name was Tamar, a woman of outstanding beauty.

verses.latin: Mansitque Absalom in Jerusalem duobus annis, et faciem regis non vidit.
verses.english: Absalom remained in Jerusalem for two full years and did not see the king’s face.

verses.latin: Misit ergo ad Joab, ut mitteret eum ad regem: qui noluit venire ad eum. Cumque secundo misisset, et ille noluisset venire,
verses.english: So Absalom sent for Joab, to send him to the king, but Joab refused to come to him. When Absalom sent a second time, and Joab still refused to come,

verses.latin: ait servis suis: Videte agrum Joab juxta agrum meum habentem segetem: ite, et succendite eum igni. Succenderunt ergo servi Absalom segetem igni.
verses.english: Absalom said to his servants, 'Look, Joab’s field is next to mine, and he has barley there. Go and set it on fire.' So Absalom’s servants set the field on fire.

verses.latin: Et veniens Joab ad Absalom in domum, dixit: Quare succenderunt servi tui segetem meam igni?
verses.english: Then Joab came to Absalom at his house and asked, 'Why did your servants set my field on fire?'

verses.latin: Et respondit Absalom Joab: Dixi: Mitte ad te, ut venias ad me, et mittam te ad regem, ut dicas ei: Quare veni de Gessur? Melius mihi erat ibi esse. Obsecro igitur, ut videam faciem regis: si est in me iniquitas, interfice me.
verses.english: Absalom answered Joab, 'I sent word to you, saying: "Come to me, so I can send you to the king, to tell him: 'Why did I even come from Geshur? It would have been better for me to stay there.'" So I beg you, let me see the king’s face. If there is any guilt in me, then kill me.'

verses.latin: Venit ergo Joab ad regem, et nuntiavit ei. Et vocatus Absalom, ingressus est ad regem, et adoravit super terram coram eo: osculatusque est rex Absalom.
verses.english: So Joab came to the king and told him everything. Then Absalom was called, and he entered the king’s presence. He bowed down to the ground before the king, and King David kissed Absalom.

verses.latin: Sciens ergo Joab filius Sarviae quod cor regis pronum esset ad Absalom,
verses.english: So Joab, the son of Zeruiah, knew that King David's heart was yearning for Absalom.

verses.latin: misit Thecuam et tulit inde mulierem sapientem et dixit ad eam: Lugere te simula et induere vestimentis lugubribus et ne ungaris oleo ut sis quasi mulier plurimis jam diebus luxerit mortuum.
verses.english: Joab sent for a wise woman from Tekoa and brought her to him. And he said to her: 'Pretend to be in mourning. Wear mourning clothes and do not put any oil on your body, so that you appear like a woman who has been mourning a dead person for many days.'

verses.latin: Et ingredere ad regem et loquere ad eum sermones istos. Et posuit Joab verba in ore ejus.
verses.english: Then go to the king and speak these words to him.' Joab put the exact words she was to say into her mouth.

verses.latin: Ingressa ergo mulier Thecuitis ad regem, cecidit coram eo super faciem suam et adoravit et dixit: Salva me rex.
verses.english: So when the woman from Tekoa came to the king, she fell before him on her face, bowed down, and said: 'Help me, my King!'

verses.latin: Et ait ad eam rex: Quid est tibi? Quae respondit: Heu mulier vidua sum: et mortuus est vir meus.
verses.english: The king said to her: 'What troubles you?' She answered: 'Alas, I am a widow, and my husband is dead.'

verses.latin: Et ancillae tuae erant duo filii: qui litigaverunt adversum se in agro, nullusque erat qui eos interponeret: et percussit alter alterum et interfecit eum.
verses.english: And your handmaid had two sons. They quarreled with each other in the field, and there was no one to separate them. So one struck the other and killed him.

verses.latin: Et ecce consurgens universa cognatio contra ancillam tuam dicit: Trade eum qui percussit fratrem suum ut interficiamus eum pro anima fratris sui quem occidit et deleamus heredem. Et sic minabantur hereditatem meam quam reliqui et non relinquent viro meo nomen et reliquias super terram.
verses.english: And behold, all the relatives rose up against your handmaid, saying: 'Hand over the one who struck his brother, so we may kill him for the life of his brother whom he murdered, and destroy the heir!' They are threatening to wipe out my only remaining family and prevent my husband's name and descendants from continuing on the earth.

verses.latin: Et ait rex ad mulierem: Vade in domum tuam et ego de te praecipiam.
verses.english: The king said to the woman: 'Go to your house, and I will give orders concerning you.'

verses.latin: Et dixit mulier Thecuitis ad regem: In me Domine mi rex iniquitas, et in domum patris mei: rex autem et thronus ejus sit innocens.
verses.english: The woman from Tekoa said to the king: 'My Lord, my King, let the guilt be on me and on my father's house. But let the king and his throne be innocent.'

verses.latin: Et ait rex: Qui contradixerit tibi, adduc illum ad me et ultra non addet super te.
verses.english: The king said: 'Whoever speaks against you, bring him to me, and he will not trouble you again.'

verses.latin: Et ait illa: Recordetur rex Domini Dei sui ut non multilicetur proximus sanguinis ad ulciscendum et nequaquam interficiant filium meum. Et ait: Vivit Dominus, si cadet de capillis filii tui in terram.
verses.english: She said: 'May the king remember the Lord his God, so that the avenger of blood does not multiply his vengeance and by no means kill my son.' The king then swore: 'As the Lord lives, not one hair of your son's head shall fall to the ground!'

verses.latin: Dixitque mulier: Loquatur ancilla tua ad dominum meum regem verbum.
verses.english: Then the woman said: 'May your handmaid speak a word to my lord, the king.'

verses.latin: Et ait: Loquere. Et dixit mulier: Quare ergo cogitas hujuscemodi rem contra populum Dei? et quasi delinquens loquitur rex hoc verbo, ut non revocet ejectum suum.
verses.english: He said: 'Speak.' And the woman said: 'Why then do you intend such a thing against the people of God? For in speaking this word, the king condemns himself, because he does not recall his own banished son, Absalom.'

verses.latin: Omnes morimur et quasi aquae dilabimur in terram quae non revertuntur: et nescit Deus tollere animam, sed magis cogitat ne pereat qui abjectus est.
verses.english: We all must die, and we are like water poured out on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again. God does not take away a soul instantly but rather devises ways for the banished to not perish, that they may be brought back.

verses.latin: Nunc igitur veni ut loquar ad dominum meum regem verbum hoc, timens ne forte terreret me populus: et dixit ancilla tua: Loquar ad regem si quo modo faciat rex verbum ancillae suae.
verses.english: So now, I have come to speak this word to my lord, the king, fearing that perhaps the people might frighten me. And your handmaid said: 'I will speak to the king, if perhaps the king will grant his handmaid's request.'

verses.latin: Audiet enim rex ut liberet ancillam suam de manu viri volentis eruere me et filium meum simul de hereditate Domini.
verses.english: For the king will surely listen and deliver his handmaid from the hand of any man who would try to disinherit both me and my son from the Lord's inheritance.

verses.latin: Dixitque ancilla tua: Sit verbum domini mei regis ut quietum me faciat. Sicut enim angelus Dei, sic dominus meus rex est ut discernat bonum et malum: et Dominus Deus tuus sit tecum.
verses.english: And your handmaid said: 'May the word of my lord the king bring me peace.' For my lord the king is like an angel of God, discerning good and evil. May the Lord your God be with you.

verses.latin: Et respondens rex dixit ad mulierem: Ne abscondas a me verbum quod te interrogo.
verses.english: The king answered and said to the woman: 'Do not hide from me the word I am about to ask you.'

verses.latin: Et ait mulier: Loquatur dominus meus rex. Et ait rex: Numquid manus Joab tecum est in omnibus istis?
verses.english: The woman said: 'Let my lord the king speak.' And the king said: 'Is the hand of Joab with you in all this?'

verses.latin: Et respondit mulier et ait: Per salutem animae tuae domine mi rex, nec declinat ad dextram vel ad sinistram ab omnibus his quae locutus es tu ancilla tua: tu enim domine mi rex, sicut angelus Dei sapis ut intellegas omnia super terram. Joab servus tuus ipse praecepit mihi, et ipse posuit in os ancillae tuae omnia verba haec.
verses.english: The woman answered and said: 'By the life of your soul, my lord the king, nothing you have said turns to the right or to the left from what your handmaid has uttered. For my lord the king, you are as wise as an angel of God, able to understand all things on earth. Your servant Joab himself commanded me, and he himself put all these words into the mouth of your handmaid.'

verses.latin: Propter hoc ergo feci sermonem istum ut justas facerem hanc causam: et Joab servus tuus praecepit mihi.
verses.english: Therefore, I spoke this word to bring about justice in this matter, for your servant Joab instructed me to do so.

verses.latin: Et loquebatur ancilla tua ad dominum meum regem, quasi ut reversione sermonis explerem. Tu enim domine mi rex quasi angelus Dei es ut teneas omnia. Quam ob rem ut sapis, ita fac.
verses.english: And your handmaid spoke to my lord the king, as if to fulfill the purpose of these words. For you, my lord the king, are like an angel of God in your understanding of all things. Therefore, do as you see fit in your wisdom.

verses.latin: Et ait rex ad Joab: Ecce propitius factus sum sermoni tuo et vade reduc puerum Absalom.
verses.english: The king then said to Joab: 'See, I have granted your request. Go, bring back the young man Absalom.'

verses.latin: Et cadens Joab super faciem suam in terram adoravit et benedixit regi: et dixit Joab: Hodie intellexit servus tuus quia inveni gratiam in oculis tuis domine mi rex: quoniam fecit rex verbum servi sui.
verses.english: Joab fell on his face to the ground, bowed down, and blessed the king. And Joab said: 'Today your servant understands that I have found favor in your eyes, my lord the king, because the king has granted his servant's request.'

verses.latin: Reduxit ergo Joab Absalom in Jerusalem.
verses.english: So Joab brought Absalom back to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et dixit rex: Revertatur in domum suam et faciem meam non videat. Reversus est itaque Absalom in domum suam et faciem regis non vidit.
verses.english: The king said: 'Let him return to his own house and not see my face.' So Absalom returned to his house and did not see the king's face.

verses.latin: Porro Absalom natus sunt filii tres et filia una nomine Thamar elegantissima forma.
verses.english: Now, three sons and one daughter were born to Absalom. His daughter's name was Tamar, and she was very beautiful.

verses.latin: Mansitque Absalom in Jerusalem duobus annis et faciem regis non vidit.
verses.english: Absalom remained in Jerusalem for two full years and did not see the king's face.

verses.latin: Misit ergo Absalom ad Joab ut mitteret eum ad regem qui noluit venire ad eum. Cumque misisset iterato non venit.
verses.english: So Absalom sent for Joab, to send him to the king, but Joab refused to come to him. When Absalom sent a second time, Joab still did not come.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad servos suos: Videte ager Joab juxta agrum meum habentem segetem hordei: ite et succendite eum igni. Succenderunt ergo servi Absalom agrum igni.
verses.english: Then Absalom said to his servants: 'See, Joab's field is next to mine, and it has a barley crop. Go and set it on fire!' So Absalom's servants set the field on fire.

verses.latin: Et exsurgens Joab venit ad Absalom in domum suam et dixit: Quare succenderunt servi tui agrum meum igni?
verses.english: Then Joab arose and came to Absalom at his house, and said: 'Why did your servants set my field on fire?'

verses.latin: Et respondit Absalom Joab: Dixi: Mitte ad te dicens: Veni huc et mittam te ad regem ut dicas: Quare reversus sum de Gessur? Melius mihi fuisset ibi esse. Obsecro igitur ut videam faciem regis: si est in me aliqua iniquitas interficiat me.
verses.english: Absalom answered Joab: 'I sent to you, saying: 'Come here, so I may send you to the king to ask him: 'Why did I return from Geshur? It would have been better for me to have remained there.'' Therefore, I beg you, let me see the king's face. If there is any guilt in me, then let him put me to death.'

verses.latin: Venit ergo Joab ad regem et nuntiavit ei. Et vocatus Absalom ingressus est ad regem et adoravit super faciem suam in terram coram rege: osculatusque est rex Absalom.
verses.english: So Joab went to the king and told him. And Absalom was called. He entered the king's presence and bowed down on his face to the ground before the king. And the king kissed Absalom.

verses.latin: Post hæc accidit ut Absalom faceret sibi currus et equos, et quinquaginta viros qui præcederent eum.
verses.english: After these events, Absalom began to act like a king. He provided for himself chariots and horses, and fifty men to run before him.

verses.latin: Et mane consurgens Absalom stabat juxta introitum portæ: et omnem virum qui habebat negotium ut veniret ad regem pro judicio, vocabat Absalom ad se, et dicebat: De qua civitate es tu? Qui respondens, aiebat: Ex una tribuum Israël ego sum servus tuus.
verses.english: Absalom would rise early in the morning and stand at the entrance of the city gate. When anyone had a dispute to bring before the king for judgment, Absalom would call him over and ask, 'From what city are you?' The man would answer, 'Your servant is from one of the tribes of Israel.'

verses.latin: Et diceret ei Absalom: Videntur mihi sermones tui boni et justi: sed non est qui te audiat a rege constitutus.
verses.english: Then Absalom would say to him, 'Your case seems good and just to me, but there is no official appointed by the king to hear your complaint.'

verses.latin: Et adjiciebat Absalom: Quis me constitueret judicem super terram, ut ad me veniret omnis homo qui habet negotium, et juste judicarem eum?
verses.english: Absalom would then add, 'Oh, if only someone would appoint me judge over the land! Then everyone with a dispute could come to me, and I would give them justice.'

verses.latin: Sed et cum accederet ad eum homo ut salutaret, extendebat manum suam, et apprehendens osculabatur eum.
verses.english: When anyone approached Absalom to pay him homage, Absalom would extend his hand, take hold of the person, and kiss him.

verses.latin: Faciebatque hoc omni Israël qui veniebat ad judicium ut judicaretur a rege, et sollicitabat corda virorum Israël.
verses.english: Absalom did this with every Israelite who came to the king for judgment, and he slowly stole the hearts of the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Post quatuor autem annos, dixit Absalom ad regem: Vadam, et reddam votum meum quod vovi Domino in Hebron.
verses.english: After four years of this, Absalom said to King David, 'Let me go to Hebron, so I may fulfill a vow I made to the Lord there.'

verses.latin: Votum est enim servus tuus in Gessur Syriæ, cum commoraretur, dicens: Si reduxerit me Dominus in Jerusalem, sacrificabo ei.
verses.english: For your servant made a vow while living in Geshur in Syria, saying: 'If the Lord brings me back to Jerusalem, I will offer a sacrifice to Him.''

verses.latin: Dixitque ei rex: Vade in pace. Et surrexit, et abiit in Hebron.
verses.english: The king said to him, 'Go in peace.' So Absalom got up and went to Hebron.

verses.latin: Misit quoque Absalom exploratores in universas tribus Israël, dicens: Statim ut audieritis clangorem buccina, dicite: Regnavit Absalom in Hebron.
verses.english: But Absalom also sent secret messengers throughout all the tribes of Israel, telling them: 'As soon as you hear the sound of the trumpet, declare: "Absalom has become king in Hebron!"'

verses.latin: Iverant autem cum Absalom de Jerusalem ducenti viri vocati, ignorantes, et simplici corde.
verses.english: Two hundred men from Jerusalem went with Absalom. They were invited guests, completely unaware of his true intentions and went with sincere hearts.

verses.latin: Sed et Achitophel Gilonites, consiliarius David, de civitate sua Gelon venit cum Absalom. Et conjuratio valida facta est: populusque concurrens, adaugebatur cum Absalom.
verses.english: And Ahithophel the Gilonite, who was David's personal advisor, came from his city of Giloh and joined Absalom. The conspiracy became strong, and the number of people gathering with Absalom continually increased.

verses.latin: Venit itaque nuntius ad David, dicens: Toto corde Israël sequitur Absalom.
verses.english: So a messenger came to David, saying: 'The hearts of all Israel are following Absalom!'

verses.latin: Et ait David ad omnes servos suos qui erant cum eo in Jerusalem: Surgite, et fugiamus: neque enim erit nobis effugium a facie Absalom. Festinate egredi, ne forte occupet nos, et impellat super nos ruinam, et percutiat civitatem in ore gladii.
verses.english: David then said to all his servants who were with him in Jerusalem: 'Get up, let us flee! Otherwise, there will be no escape for us from Absalom. Hurry and leave, so that he doesn't overtake us, bring disaster upon us, and put the city to the sword.'

verses.latin: Dixeruntque servi regis ad eum: Omnia quæcumque præceperis dominus noster rex, libenter faciemus servi tui.
verses.english: The king's servants said to him: 'Whatever our lord the king commands, your servants are ready to do it willingly.'

verses.latin: Egressus est ergo rex, et universa domus ejus, et cunctus populus vestigia ejus. Et dereliquit rex decem mulieres concubinas, ad custodiendam domum.
verses.english: So the king went out, along with his entire household and all the people who followed him. But the king left behind ten concubine women to guard the palace.

verses.latin: Et egressus rex, et omnis Israël, pedes egressi sunt, et stetit in domo quæ procul erat.
verses.english: The king went out, and all the people of Israel followed on foot. He stopped at a house that was some distance away from the city.

verses.latin: Et universi servi ejus sequebantur per partem ejus: et omnes Cerethi et Phelethi, et universi Gethæi, sescenti viri qui secuti eum fuerant de Geth, pedes incedebant coram rege.
verses.english: All his servants marched past him; and all the Cherethites and Pelethites, and all the six hundred Gittites who had followed him from Gath, marched on foot before the king.

verses.latin: Dixitque rex Ittai Gethæo: Cur venis nobiscum? Revertere, et mane cum rege: quoniam peregrinus es, et egressus de loco tuo.
verses.english: Then the king said to Ittai the Gittite: 'Why are you coming with us? Go back and stay with the new king Absalom, for you are a foreigner and an exile from your own homeland.'

verses.latin: Heri venisti, et hodie cogaris nobiscum egredi? ego autem vadam quo iturus sum: revertere, et reduc tecum fratres tuos, et Dominus faciat tecum misericordiam, et veritatem.
verses.english: You only arrived yesterday, and now should you be forced to wander with us today? I am going wherever I must go. Go back, and take your fellow countrymen with you. May the Lord show you mercy and faithfulness.

verses.latin: Et respondit Ittai regi, dicens: Vivit Dominus, et vivit dominus meus rex: quoniam in quocumque loco fueris, domine mi rex, sive in morte, sive in vita, ibi erit servus tuus.
verses.english: But Ittai answered the king, saying: 'As the Lord lives, and as my lord the king lives, wherever my lord the king may be, whether it means death or life, there your servant will be!'

verses.latin: Et ait David Ittai: Veni, et transi. Transivit itaque Ittai Gethæus, et omnis vir ejus, et universæ parvuli qui cum eo erant.
verses.english: David said to Ittai: 'Come then, and pass by.' So Ittai the Gittite passed by, with all his men and all the little children who were with him.

verses.latin: Omnisque terra flebat voce magna, et cunctus populus transibat: rex quoque transiebat torrentem Cedron: et cunctus populus in viam quæ respicit ad desertum.
verses.english: All the land wept with a loud voice as all the people passed by. The king also crossed the Kidron Valley, and all the people headed toward the road that leads to the desert.

verses.latin: Venit autem et Sadoc, et universi Levitæ cum eo portantes arcam fœderis Dei: et deposuerunt arcam Dei, et Abiathar ascendit, donec amœnaretur omnis populus de civitate.
verses.english: And behold, Zadok came, and all the Levites with him, carrying the ark of the covenant of God. They set down the ark of God, and Abiathar also came up, waiting until all the people had finished leaving the city.

verses.latin: Et dixit rex Sadoc: Reporta arcam Dei in urbem: si invenero gratiam in oculis Domini, reducet me, et ostendet mihi eam, et tabernaculum suum.
verses.english: Then the king said to Zadok: 'Take the ark of God back into the city. If I find favor in the eyes of the Lord, He will bring me back and show me both the ark and His dwelling place.'

verses.latin: Sin autem dixerit: Non places mihi: paratus sum, faciat quod bonum est coram se.
verses.english: But if He says, 'I am not pleased with you,' then I am ready; let Him do to me whatever seems good in His sight.'

verses.latin: Et dixit rex Sadoc sacerdoti: Vides? revertere in civitatem in pace: et Achimaas filius tuus, et Jonathan filius Abiathar, duo filii vestri sint vobiscum.
verses.english: The king also said to Zadok the priest: 'Do you understand? Return to the city in peace. And let your son Ahimaaz and Abiathar's son Jonathan—your two sons—be with you.'

verses.latin: Ecce ego abscondar in campestribus deserti, donec veniat sermo a vobis indicans mihi.
verses.english: 'Look, I will hide in the plains of the desert until a message comes from you to inform me.'

verses.latin: Reportaverunt igitur Sadoc et Abiathar arcam Dei in Jerusalem: et manserunt ibi.
verses.english: So Zadok and Abiathar carried the ark of God back to Jerusalem, and they remained there.

verses.latin: Porro David ascendebat clivum Olivarum, scandens et flens: caput opertum, et ipse incedens discalceato pede: omnisque populus qui erat cum eo, operto capite singuli incedebant, plorantes.
verses.english: Meanwhile, David went up the slope of the Mount of Olives, weeping as he climbed. His head was covered, and he walked barefoot. All the people who were with him also walked with their heads covered, weeping as they went.

verses.latin: Nuntiatum est autem David ab aliquo, dicente: Achitophel est in conjuratione cum Absalom. Et ait David: Infatua, quæso, Domine, consilium Achitophel.
verses.english: Someone informed David, saying: 'Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom.' And David said: 'Please, Lord, make the counsel of Ahithophel foolish.'

verses.latin: Cumque ascendisset David summitatem montis, ex quo adorabatur Dominus, ecce occurrit ei Chusai Arachites scissa veste et terra pleno capite.
verses.english: When David reached the top of the mountain, where people worshipped the Lord, suddenly Hushai the Archite met him with his tunic torn and dirt on his head.

verses.latin: Et dixit ei David: Si veneris mecum, eris mihi oneri.
verses.english: And David said to him: 'If you come with me, you will be a burden to me.'

verses.latin: Si autem in civitatem revertaris, et dixeris Absalom: Servus tuus sum, rex: sicut fui servus patris tui sic ero et tuus: dissipabis consilium Achitophel.
verses.english: 'But if you return to the city and say to Absalom: "I am your servant, O king! Just as I was your father's servant, so now I will be yours," then you can thwart the counsel of Ahithophel for me.'

verses.latin: Habes autem tecum ibi Sadoc et Abiathar sacerdotes: et omne verbum quodcumque audieris de domo regis, nuntiabis Sadoc et Abiathar sacerdotibus.
verses.english: 'You will have Zadok and Abiathar the priests with you there. Every word you hear from the king's household, you must report to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.'

verses.latin: Habent quippe secum duos filios suos Achimaas Sadoc, et Jonathan Abiathar: et mittetis per eos omne verbum quodcumque audieritis.
verses.english: 'Indeed, they have their two sons with them: Ahimaaz, Zadok's son, and Jonathan, Abiathar's son. Through them, you can send me every message you hear.'

verses.latin: Ingressus est itaque Chusai amicus David in civitatem: porro Absalom ingressus est Jerusalem.
verses.english: So Hushai, David's loyal friend, went back into the city. Just as Hushai entered, Absalom also entered Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Post haec Absalom fecit sibi currus et equites, et quinquaginta viros qui praecederent eum.
verses.english: After these events, Absalom acquired for himself chariots and horsemen, and also fifty men who would run before him, establishing a royal display.

verses.latin: Et mane consurgens, stabat juxta introitum portae: et cum esset viro negotium ut veniret ad regem pro judicio, vocabat eum Absalom, et dicebat: De qua civitate es tu? Qui respondens, ait: De una de tribubus Israel ego sum servus tuus.
verses.english: And rising early in the morning, Absalom would stand beside the main entrance of the city gate—the place where legal cases were heard. When a man had a dispute and was on his way to the king for judgment, Absalom would call to him and ask: "From what city are you?" The man would reply: "I am your servant, from one of the tribes of Israel."

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eum Absalom: Videntur mihi sermones tui boni et justi; sed non est qui te audiat a rege.
verses.english: Then Absalom would say to him: "Your case is sound and just, but unfortunately, there is no one appointed by the king to properly hear you."

verses.latin: Et subjunxit: Quis me constituat judicem super terram, ut ad me veniant omnes qui habent negotium, et juste judicem eos?
verses.english: And he would add with a sigh: "If only someone would make me judge over the land! Then everyone with a dispute could come to me, and I would certainly give them justice."

verses.latin: Sed et cum accederet homo, ut adoraret eum, extendebat manum suam, et apprehensum osculabatur.
verses.english: And if a person would approach to show him deference—by bowing down—Absalom would extend his hand, take hold of him, and kiss him.

verses.latin: Faciebatque hoc omni Israeli qui veniebat ad judicium, et sollicitabat corda virorum Israel.
verses.english: Absalom acted in this way with every Israelite who came for judgment, and by doing so, he stole the loyalty of the men of Israel.

verses.latin: Post quatuor autem annos, dixit Absalom ad regem: Vadam, et reddam votum meum quod vovi Domino in Hebron.
verses.english: After four years had passed, Absalom said to the king: "Please allow me to go to Hebron, so that I may fulfill the vow I made to the Lord there."

verses.latin: Votum enim vovi servus tuus cum essem in Gessur Syriae, dicens: Si reduxerit me Dominus in Jerusalem, sacrificabo illi.
verses.english: He added: "For while your servant was in Geshur in Syria, I made a vow saying: 'If the Lord brings me back to Jerusalem, I will offer a sacrifice to Him.'"

verses.latin: Dixitque ei rex: Vade in pace. Et surrexit, et abiit in Hebron.
verses.english: And the king said to him: "Go in peace." So Absalom rose and went to Hebron.

verses.latin: Misit autem Absalom exploratores in universas tribus Israel, dicens: Statim ut audieritis clangorem buccinae, dicite: Regnavit Absalom in Hebron.
verses.english: But Absalom had secretly sent messengers throughout all the tribes of Israel with this instruction: "As soon as you hear the sound of the trumpet, declare: 'Absalom is now king in Hebron!'"

verses.latin: Porro de Jerusalem ierunt cum Absalom ducenti viri invitati, ignorantes omnino absconditum negotium.
verses.english: Furthermore, two hundred men from Jerusalem, who had been invited by Absalom, went with him, completely unaware of his secret plot.

verses.latin: Sed et Achitophel Gilonites consiliarius David, de civitate sua Geloh, venit cum Absalom. Et conjuratio valida facta est: populusque concurrens, Absalom augebatur.
verses.english: Achitophel the Gilonite, David's trusted advisor, also came from his city of Giloh and joined Absalom. The conspiracy grew strong, and the number of people gathering with Absalom continually increased.

verses.latin: Venit igitur nuntius ad David, dicens: Toto corde Israel transiit ad Absalom.
verses.english: So a messenger came to David, reporting: "The hearts of all Israel have turned completely to Absalom."

verses.latin: Et ait David ad omnes servos suos, qui erant cum eo in Jerusalem: Surgite, et fugiamus: neque enim erit nobis effugium a facie Absalom. Festinate egredi, ne forte occupet nos, et alligat nos, et percutiat civitatem in ore gladii.
verses.english: Then David said to all his servants who were with him in Jerusalem: "Get up, let us flee! Otherwise, there will be no escape for us from Absalom. Hurry and leave, lest he quickly overtake us, surround us, and strike the city with the edge of the sword."

verses.latin: Et dixerunt servi regis ad eum: Omnia quacumque praeceperit dominus noster rex, fideles tui ad omnia sumus.
verses.english: The king's servants responded to him: "Whatever our lord the king commands, we, your faithful servants, are ready to do it all."

verses.latin: Et egressus est rex, et universa domus ejus pedibus: et dereliquit rex decem mulieres concubinas, ad custodiendam domum.
verses.english: So the king departed, and his entire household followed on foot. However, the king left behind ten concubines to guard the palace.

verses.latin: Egressusque rex, et omnis populus vestigia ejus sequentium, stetit ad domum longinquam.
